=== Teleporter ===
Description: The Teleporter is a travel mechanism from the Mechanic / the Steampunker for 250. When two Teleporters are wired together with a triggering mechanism, they can exchange players, NPCs, and most enemies between them. Teleporting is always instantaneous, has no load time or cooldown, no Mana or coin cost, and no limit on distance. Unlike most furniture, Teleporters are foreground objects. They consist of three inseparable blocks which, like all block types, can individually be shaped with a hammer or actuated. The two Teleporters to be transported between must be placed on a surface of solid blocks or platforms and connected by Wire, along with a trigger mechanism, such as a Switch or Pressure Plate. When the trigger is activated, all players, all NPCs, and most enemies touching the 3×3-tile area above it are instantly transported to the other Teleporter. A character standing a maximum of three tile heights above the Teleporter can still be transported, and burying a Teleporter two tiles deep can still transport players walking on the surface. Similarly, placing an actuated, flattened (hammered to half-height) Teleporter on platforms and standing one tile below the platforms will also transport the player. Entities retain their location relative to the Teleporter within the 3×3 area when teleporting. For instance, players using a Teleporter two tiles above its surface will arrive two tiles above the surface of the destination Teleporter. See the gallery below for example images. Teleporting is always two-way: when a connection is activated, both ends will exchange all players, NPCs, and enemies that are at least partially occupying any square of the 3×3-tile rectangle. Players should keep this in mind when constructing Teleporter paths, as enemies could unintentionally be brought into a base, for example. When a wire network (single color) with more than two Teleporters is activated, an algorithm determines which pair will activate. This algorithm was rather naive prior to the 1.2.3 update and was improved afterward. Both versions are described below. Both algorithms are deterministic (i.e., their result can be predicted ahead of time), so a fixed wiring layout will always activate the same Teleporters. Therefore, the wiring layout can be designed to target the desired Teleporter. The following images demonstrate the "relative-location-retaining" property of Teleporters described above.

=== Conveyor Belt ===
Description: Conveyor Belts (Clockwise and Counter Clockwise) are Hardmode blocks purchased from the Steampunker for 5 each. They have the unique ability to automatically move players, dropped items, placed Golf Balls and town NPCs (but not enemies or critters) in their respective direction upon contact. Conveyor Belts will remain active from the moment they are placed. Although they do not require any Wire, they can be wired to reverse their direction (toggling between Clockwise and Counter Clockwise). Like most other blocks, they can be shaped into half-blocks and angled slopes using a hammer, allowing for diagonal movement.

=== Tizona ===
Description: The Tizona is a post-Ocram sword that has the ability to cause the Bleeding debuff upon impact. It is capable of autoswing and prevents the player from turning while swinging. When swung, a yellow/red fire animation is shown, similar to the visuals of the Fiery Greatsword, but does not inflict the On Fire! debuff. Its best modifier is Legendary. On the Console version and Mobile version, the Tizona was replaced with a Chlorophyte Claymore upon updating to the 1.3.0.1 equivalent.

=== Glow Tulip ===
Description: The Glow Tulip is a pet-summoning item that summons a Caveling Gardener pet that follows the player around. It can be found as a plant in the Underground or Cavern layers around the outskirts of the world. A set number of Glow Tulips are spawned during world generation: 2 in small worlds, 4 in medium worlds, and 6 in large worlds, split between the left and right sides of the world. It can also be detected by the Metal Detector.

=== The Doctor's set ===
Description: The Doctor's set is a vanity set made up of the The Doctor's Shirt and The Doctor's Pants. They are purchased from the Clothier for 40 (set) in total, during Waning Gibbous. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.


=== Gray Zapinator ===
Description: The Gray Zapinator is a pre-Hardmode-only magic weapon purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 17. It is only available once the Eye of Cthulhu, Eater of Worlds/Brain of Cthulhu, Queen Bee, or Skeletron has been defeated. Unlike the Zapinator, the Gray Zapinator does not autofire. Meteor armor's set bonus will reduce the mana cost of the Gray Zapinator (and Orange Zapinator) to 0, although the stated mana cost will not change. The weapon fires a laser beam which behaves very erratically. Upon striking an enemy, the projectile slows down by 40%, decreases its current damage and knockback by 10%, and can choose from an assortment of special effects as described below. The laser beam will disappear after hitting eight enemies or after 60 seconds. Its best modifier is Mythical. Upon hitting an enemy, the beam can do any (and perhaps more than one) of the following things:[1] These effects are applied in the given order. While it is possible for a projectile to trigger all of them at once upon hitting an enemy, it is also possible that none of them are triggered.


=== Nimbus Rod ===
Description: The Nimbus Rod is a Hardmode magic weapon that creates clouds that cause damaging "rain" projectiles to fire downward. When cast, a cloud projectile is fired from the rod and travels towards the cursor. Upon reaching its destination or colliding with a solid block, the cloud stops and starts sending rain particles downward. Each drop of rain deals the weapon's stated damage and pierces through up to 5 enemies. Each cloud lasts for 5 minutes. Up to two clouds can be spawned at once; using the weapon when there are already two active clouds will cause the oldest cloud to disappear. The Nimbus Rod has a 6.67*1/15 (6.67%) chance of dropping from an Angry Nimbus, which spawns during rain. Its best modifier is Demonic or Deadly for damage output, or Mystic for mana conservation because it cannot get modifiers that affect knockback. Because of the weapon's negligible mana cost, Demonic is usually preferred.


=== Chlorophyte Ore ===
Description: Chlorophyte Ore is a Hardmode ore found in the Underground Jungle that is used to craft Chlorophyte Bars. When Hardmode starts, Mud Blocks located near Jungle grass blocks (i.e., most often only in the Underground Jungle) will begin to convert themselves into Chlorophyte Ore. A pickaxe or drill with at least 200% pickaxe power is required to mine it, meaning it requires the Pickaxe Axe or Drax at the very least, whose materials require defeating all three mechanical bosses (although on Windows Phone and 3DS, the Drax can sometimes be found in Shadow Chests). Chlorophyte Ore will slowly spread itself by converting adjacent Mud and Jungle grass blocks into more Chlorophyte Ore, growing to large deposits over time. Furthermore, this allows it to be "replanted" and artificially seeded for a nearly renewable source of Chlorophyte. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, Old Chinese version, tModLoader version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, Chlorophyte will also attempt to spread by converting nearby Dirt Blocks to Mud, as well as Corrupt, Crimson, Hallowed and regular grass blocks to Jungle grass. Chlorophyte Ore can only spread and convert blocks if it is in or below the bottom half of the Underground layer. It can only spread itself to directly adjacent tiles (and only if there is not too much Chlorophyte nearby already) and can only convert tiles up to five tiles away.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Chlorophyte Ore
Ingredients: Luminite
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation


=== Spider Wall ===
Description: The Spider Wall is a background wall found naturally generated in Spider Nests, where they are considered unsafe. The player can create safe Spider Walls via crafting, and unsafe Spider Walls by placing Infested Spider Wall (obtained by throwing a crafted Spider Wall into Shimmer). Unsafe Spider Walls will drop nothing when destroyed with a hammer. They can spawn Wall Creepers in pre-Hardmode and Black Recluses in Hardmode, and therefore cannot be used for proper housing. They can create Cobwebs over time, with a 25*1/4 (25%) chance to yield a Cobweb item when destroyed. Infested Spider Walls, visually identical to Spider Walls, can be placed to enlarge an existing Spider Nest, or create a new one. Safe Spider Walls are crafted. Like other craftable walls, they drop as an item if destroyed with a hammer, and do not spawn enemies once placed, making them suitable for housing. They do not spawn Cobwebs nor contribute to a Spider Nest biome.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: only:Spider Wall4
Ingredients: Cobweb
Crafting Station: Work Bench and Ecto Mist


=== 1.2 ===
Description: 1.2 "Terraria 1.2" Release date September 30, 2013 [1] Version chronology ← Previous Next → 1.1.2 1.2.0.1 Version history • All patches The 1.2 update introduced a massive amount of new features, as well as balances to Hardmode gameplay.


=== Vilethorn ===
Description: The Vilethorn is a magic weapon that extends a 15-tile-long spear-like projection from the player's position. It passes through blocks, pierces multiple enemies, and scores a rapid succession of up to 7 hits per enemy. Its total effect lasts roughly 1.5 seconds. It is one of the possible drops from destroying a Shadow Orb in the Corruption, but it can also be obtained from Corrupt Crates, which are caught from fishing in the Corruption. The Vilethorn also inflicts minuscule knockback for each hit, which can stun-lock enemies. Its best modifier is Mythical.


=== Gold Bunny ===
Description: The Gold Bunny is a harmless Critter. It is a recolor of an ordinary Bunny, with a 0.25*1/400 (0.25%) / 0.67*1/150 (0.67%) chance of spawning in place of the ordinary version. However, it cannot be spawned by a Bunny Statue. As with all other gold critters, it can be caught with a Bug Net and sold for 10. It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades. The Bestiary entry for the Gold Bunny: "Rarely, critters are found coated entirely in gold! Shopkeepers will pay handsomely for these, or you can show them off in cages!"

The height of the first jump is increased from 6 blocks to 10½ blocks (~75% increase), while the double-jump's height is increased from 8 blocks to 14½ blocks, reaching a total of 25 blocks with both jumps. Jump height is oddly reduced when underwater, reducing your total underwater height from 19 blocks (8 + 11 from Blizzard jump) to 16 blocks (7 + 9 from Blizzard jump).

The Ice Sickle has a 1*1/100 (1%) / 0.56*7/1250 (0.56%) chance of being dropped by Armored Vikings, Ice Elementals, Ice Tortoises, and Icy Mermen in the Hardmode Snow and Ice biomes. Its best modifier is Legendary.

=== Ropes ===
Description: Ropes are placeable items that primarily provide quick vertical mobility. They can be placed adjacent to blocks in any direction, or in midair where background walls are present. Once placed, Ropes are used by pressing ▲ Up or ▼ Down while moving over them. Streamers and Chains operate identically to Rope, but cannot be crafted into Rope Coils. All Rope variants operate identically, but Silk and Web Ropes are immune to falling lava, as opposed to normal and Vine Ropes, which will be dislodged similar to Torches. All ropes are acquired in different ways: Visually, the player appears to move along Rope using a mechanical tool with wheels, as though they were riding a rail. This tool appears automatically when using Rope, does not exist as a separate item, and is available from the beginning of the game. Vertical movement speed on Rope equals that of a free fall, though moving down via Rope and hitting the ground will not cause fall damage. Horizontal movement is also possible, by placing adjacent Rope horizontally, but is much slower. Rope can be placed atop existing placed Rope, which will extend the total length of the rope downward, without the player actually having to be at the bottom of the Rope column. All Rope types can be crafted into their respective Rope Coils, consumable items useful for placing Ropes in inaccessible locations.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Web Rope3
Ingredients: Cobweb
Crafting Station: By Hand
----------------------------------------
Result: Silk Rope30
Ingredients: Silk
Crafting Station: Loom

On PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version it can also be purchased from the Skeleton Merchant for 1 during a full moon. It can be upgraded into the Enchanted Boomerang with a Fallen Star. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.

=== Pwnhammer ===
Description: The Pwnhammer is a Hardmode hammer that is able to destroy Demon Altars and Crimson Altars with a few hits, blessing the world with one of the six Hardmode ores. It is always dropped by the Wall of Flesh. It has a sparkle effect when used which gives off a good deal of light, even in complete darkness. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.


=== Psycho Knife ===
Description: The Psycho Knife is a Hardmode, post-Plantera melee weapon that has a 2.5*1/40 (2.5%) / 4.94*79/1600 (4.94%) chance to be dropped by the Psycho during the Solar Eclipse event. When holding the Psycho Knife and standing still, the player will quickly enter stealth mode, causing them to turn almost completely transparent, move much more slowly, and no longer be targeted by enemies. Stealth mode is engaged gradually over the course of about one second, during which the weapon's stats are steadily boosted up to the following values: Stealth mode is disengaged when successfully attacking an enemy, when switching to a different weapon or when riding a mount. Swinging the weapon alone does not cancel stealth, nor does walking or flying. Standing still again afterward re-engages it. Moving or swinging the weapon during the one-second transition period, however, will cancel stealth mode. Its best modifier is Legendary. Due to rounding, the Light modifier gives the same speed bonus as Legendary, with fewer other bonuses.


=== Bone Helm ===
Description: The Bone Helm is an Expert Mode accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by the Deerclops. When equipped, it summons Shadow Hands to damage enemies. These Shadow Hands are spawned a distance from enemies before flying at them, piercing anything in their path including blocks. Their flight behavior mirrors the Shadow Hands found in the Deerclops fight, either flying straight or swerving harshly in flight. The hands can pierce a maximum of three enemies, and are not affected by any damage buffs.

The Merfolk form replaces the Werewolf form if entering water at night. The buffs from the Moon Charm: The buff from the Neptune's Shell:

=== Adamantite Drill ===
Description: The Adamantite Drill is a Hardmode drill, and is the drill alternative to the Adamantite Pickaxe. Appearances and sounds aside, the two tools are nearly functionally identical. The drill, however is half a second faster. But, unlike pickaxes, most drills cannot be reforged with size, speed, or knockback modifiers. It can mine any block except Chlorophyte Ore and Lihzahrd Bricks. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it, and furthermore cannot get modifiers that affect its speed, either.

=== Platinum Shortsword ===
Description: The Platinum Shortsword is the platinum equivalent of the Gold Shortsword. It is currently the second most powerful shortsword in the game, and the strongest ore-based shortsword. It deals more damage and attacks faster than its gold alternative, and is surpassed in base damage by the Gladius. Like all shortswords, the Platinum Shortsword has a very limited range and attacks with a stabbing motion at any direction on PC, Console, Mobile, and tModLoader, and horizontally in front of the player on Old-gen console, Windows Phone, Old Chinese, 3DS, and tModLoader Legacy, instead of an arc. This makes it almost useless against flying or jumping enemies, although its high attack rate makes it somewhat effective against weaker fighter type enemies. Its best modifier is Legendary.

=== Adamantite Waraxe ===
Description: The Adamantite Waraxe is a Hardmode axe that is obtainable after crafting an Adamantite Forge or a Titanium Forge, and is the axe alternative to the Adamantite Chainsaw. Along with its slightly stronger alternate, the Titanium Waraxe, it is stronger than the Mythril or Orichalcum Waraxe, making it one of the strongest that can be obtained before defeating the mechanical bosses. Like all other axes and chainsaws, it is solely used to cut down trees, cacti and Giant Glowing Mushrooms. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool.

=== Clinger Staff ===
Description: The Clinger Staff is a Hardmode magic weapon that has a 20*1/5 (20%) chance to be dropped by a Corrupt Mimic. It generates a 15-tile-high wall of Cursed Flame, which deals damage and inflicts the Cursed Inferno debuff to any enemy that walks through it. The point at which the wall is generated must be in a direct line of sight; otherwise, the wall will not generate, though still consume mana. The Clinger Staff's wall lasts for 5 minutes. Only one wall may be generated at a time; if another is summoned, the first one will vanish. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but the only stats that improve damage output are damage and critical chance. Switching to a different magic weapon causes existing projectiles to use that weapon's critical chance instead, meaning that the Clinger Staff's DPS is optimized with the Ruthless modifier when used in the intended way.


=== Daybloom ===
Description: Daybloom is a type of Herb that appears as a small yellow flower with a straight stem. It grows naturally on Grass and can be collected with virtually any Weapon or Tool. Daybloom can also be planted in Clay Pots and Planter Boxes using Daybloom Seeds, or gathered by defeating Angry Dandelions. Dayblooms usually grow during the Day. If the yellow sunflower-like head is visible, the Daybloom is blooming and ready to be harvested. If cut during the day, 1-3 Daybloom Seeds and 1 Daybloom will drop. Both Daybloom and their respective seeds have a chance to be obtained from the Herb Bag.

=== True Night's Edge ===
Description: The True Night's Edge is a Hardmode sword. It almost has the highest base damage of any Pre-Plantera sword only being beaten by the Chlorophyte Claymore. It is also a stronger version of the Night's Edge, doing more damage and firing a glowing, spinning, green circle projectile called "Night Beam" in the direction of the cursor every .86 seconds on average. Because this ability has a short cooldown, not every swing of the sword launches a Night Beam. The True Night's Edge is one of the ingredients required to craft the Terra Blade. On the PC, Console, Mobile, 3DS, and tModLoader versions, the True Night's Edge is able to autoswing. As of 1.4.4, the True Night's Edge now fires a spinning purple and green energy blade. This projectile is unique in that it moves with the player, meaning if the player is falling quickly and swings the sword, the projectile will not get left behind, and will stay in the same position relative to the player, albeit flying away. This can make it difficult to use, especially against bosses, as it forces the player to remain aligned with an enemy in order to use the projectile effectively, which makes dodging while firing sword projectiles at an enemy less viable. Its best modifier is Legendary. PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version: Old-gen console version, Windows Phone version, Old Chinese version, Nintendo 3DS version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version:

=== Hat Rack ===
Description: The Hat Rack is a decorative furniture item that can be used to display up to two helmet-slot armor and vanity items, as well as dyes. Items can be placed on a Hat Rack by pressing the ⚷ Interact button on it, which opens a small set of inventory-like slots beneath the player's main inventory. There are two slots for two helmets, in addition to an associated dye slot underneath each one. Placing items in these slots immediately displays them on the Hat Rack. Items placed in the left slot are displayed on the upper part of the Hat Rack, while items placed in the right slot are displayed on the lower part. Items cannot be displayed on the middle, top part.

Ingredients: Any Wood16
Crafting Station: Sawmill


=== Marrow ===
Description: The Marrow is a Hardmode bow that has a 0.5*1/200 (0.5%) chance to be dropped by Skeleton Archers. When fired, the next available arrow will instead be converted into a special Bone Arrow, which fires at a higher velocity than average arrows. However, while the used arrow's base damage is accounted for, special properties of converted arrows are entirely lost. The Marrow has a base 9% critical strike chance, as opposed to the usual 4%. Its best modifier is Unreal.


=== Deerclops Eyeball ===
Description: The Deerclops Eyeball is a pet-summoning item that has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance of dropping from the Deerclops in Master Mode. It summons a Tiny Deerclops that will follow the player around. If it is too far away from the player, a bird will carry it by its horn to continue following the player.


=== Dart Trap ===
Description: Dart Traps are traps that fire poisoned darts when triggered via wire. The trap does not consume any ammunition, its output being limited only by how frequently it can be triggered, which is a maximum of once every 3 1/3 seconds ( 3 seconds). Dart Traps are found naturally placed in random areas in the Cavern layer, and more frequently in the Dungeon, and can be freed and harvested by players with a pickaxe or drill. They are found wired to Pressure Plates that trigger when the player or an enemy steps on them. In order to use harvested Dart Traps, players must wire them to a triggering mechanism that sends a signal to the trap, which can be done with tools available from the Mechanic (who can be found in the Dungeon after Skeletron is defeated). Dart Traps will be placed facing the direction the player is facing, and on the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, tModLoader version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, can be hammered to rotate them after being placed, allowing them to fire vertically.


=== Waterleaf ===
Description: Waterleaf is a type of herb which appears as a very small, aqua-colored sprout. It can be found growing on Sand and Pearlsand Blocks and can be cut with virtually any weapon or tool. On PC, Console, Mobile, Old Chinese, tModLoader, and tModLoader Legacy, it can also be planted in Clay Pots and Planter Boxes using Waterleaf Seeds, which drop from blooming Waterleaf. Waterleaf will only bloom once fully grown and when it is raining or snowing. While blooming, its appearance will change, becoming larger and speckled with aqua leaves. A blooming Waterleaf will also emit little globes of water. Note that it does not need to be raining or snowing directly on the plant in order for it to bloom: rain or snow simply needs to occur. On the Nintendo 3DS version, Waterleaf plants are required to be at least partially submerged in water before they bloom and drop seeds. It does not matter if it is raining or not. Both Waterleaf and their respective seeds have a chance to be obtained from the Herb Bag.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Garland
Ingredients: DaybloomMoonglowBlinkrootWaterleafDeathweedShiverthornFireblossom
Crafting Station: By Hand
----------------------------------------
Result: only:Crate Potion
Ingredients: Bottled WaterAmberMoonglowShiverthornWaterleaf
Crafting Station: Placed BottleorAlchemy Table


=== Explosive Bunny ===
Description: The Explosive Bunny is an item that serves as ammunition for the Bunny Cannon. Crafting it requires a Bunny, which must be caught with any Bug Net. It can be released as a critter, and will wander around like other critters. On death, it will explode, dealing damage but not destroying tiles. It will always be placed at the player's feet when released, instead of at the cursor like most other critters. The Bestiary entry for the Explosive Bunny: "Not the typical garden-variety bunny. This one has been tampered with, and has an explosive temper as a result."

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Explosive Bunny
Ingredients: BunnyDynamite
Crafting Station: By Hand


=== Snow Wall ===
Description: Snow Walls are naturally-occurring background Walls found in Snow Biomes. They can be destroyed with the Hammer, but can't be picked up as an item. Old-gen console version, Windows Phone version, Old Chinese version, Nintendo 3DS version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version Snow Walls cannot be crafted by the player. Therefore, they can never be placed or utilized in any other way by the player. PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version Snow Walls can be crafted from Snow Blocks at a Work Bench with Ecto Mist.

=== Dragon Egg ===
Description: The Dragon Egg is a Pet summoning item that gives the player a Hoardagron pet. It has a 16.67% / 25% chance to be dropped by the Dark Mage(T1) and a 8.33% chance to be dropped from Dark Mage(T3) during the Old One's Army event.


=== Wand of Sparking ===
Description: The Wand of Sparking is an early-game magic weapon found in regular Chests on the Surface or in the Underground layer. It can also be purchased from the Skeleton Merchant during a third quarter moon. It fires a piercing spark along a parabolic curve, traveling about 16 tiles before dissipating. The spark has a 50*1/2 (50%) chance to inflict the On Fire! debuff for 0.5–2 seconds (66.67*2/3 (66.67%) chance) or 1–3 seconds (33.33*1/3 (33.33%) chance). It deals no knockback. Its best modifier is Demonic or Deadly, with the former granting improved critical strike chance and the latter granting improved speed. It cannot get modifiers that affect knockback or mana cost.

=== Pocket Mirror ===

=== Brain Scrambler ===
Description: The Brain Scrambler is a Hardmode, post-Golem enemy that appears during the Martian Madness event. It fires green laser projectiles, at a maximum fire rate of once every 0.67 seconds (40 ticks[1]),[2] which have a chance to inflict the Confused debuff.


=== Super Dart Trap ===
Description: The Super Dart Trap is a post-Plantera trap found inside the Jungle Temple and, rarely, outside the Temple's door. Like its lesser counterpart, the Dart Trap, it fires a dart when activated via wire, which costs no ammunition, but a cooldown period of 3.33 seconds / 3 seconds is required between firings. The dart is not affected by gravity and poisons the target, the poison lasting for 15 seconds and dealing 1 damage every half-second. The dart does less damage to the player at close range and roughly 80 damage to an unarmored player at further range. Unlike Lihzahrd Bricks, freeing Super Dart Traps does not require the Picksaw.

Stepping in water or submerging the head extinguishes it and the projectile effectively becomes that of a regular Mace. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.

Gold Seahorses have a 0.25*1/400 (0.25%) chance to spawn instead of the regular variant. It can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into a Seahorse Cage to be used as decorative furniture. Once crafted, the caged Seahorse cannot be released again, and when placed down it moves around inside the cage as it would do outside.

=== Mechanical Skull ===
Description: The Mechanical Skull is a boss-summoning item used to summon Skeletron Prime, a Hardmode version of Skeletron. It can only be used at night, which means consuming this item during day will not spawn Skeletron Prime. It is also unusable when the boss is already present. It can be used in any world, but usually only becomes accessible in a Hardmode World. If Skeletron Prime has not been defeated yet in a Hardmode world, all enemies have a 0.04*1/2500 (0.04%) chance of dropping this item, with the exception of statue-spawned enemies, Meteor Heads, and Old One's Army enemies.

=== Star in a Bottle ===
Description: The Star in a Bottle is a Lantern variant. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, Old Chinese version, tModLoader version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, it provides players in its vicinity with an increased rate of mana regeneration (5 extra mana per second). The buff is applied to any players standing within a rectangular area of 169×125[1] () / 100×84 () tiles centered on the bottle, similar to the Campfire and Heart Lantern. Similarly to other Lanterns, the Star in a Bottle is a mechanism that can be toggled on or off if wired, though this does not affect the buff. On the Old-gen console version, Windows Phone version, and Nintendo 3DS version, it does not provide any buff, and is only for decorative lighting.

The particular drum sound played is determined by the distance from the character to the cursor. === Slap Hand ===
Description: The Slap Hand is a Hardmode melee weapon that is notable for having extremely high knockback – a rating of 20, the highest value among all player-caused sources of knockback. Aside from this, it functions as a normal broadsword, swung over the player. It is purchased from the Skeleton Merchant for 25 during a Hardmode Blood Moon. Its best modifier is Legendary.


=== Orichalcum Drill ===
Description: The Orichalcum Drill is a Hardmode drill, and is the drill alternative to the Orichalcum Pickaxe. Appearances and sounds aside, the two tools are nearly functionally identical. The drill, however is half a second faster. But, unlike pickaxes, most drills cannot be reforged with size, speed, or knockback modifiers. It can mine any block except Chlorophyte Ore and Lihzahrd Bricks. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it, and furthermore cannot get modifiers that affect its speed, either.

On the Old-gen console, Windows Phone, Old Chinese, 3DS, and tModLoader Legacy versions, the player must have defeated Plantera and have the Pygmy Staff in their inventory.


=== Boreal Crate ===

Boreal Crates contain items found in standard crates, and always contain one item normally found in Frozen Chests. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Frozen Crate. === Sign ===
Description: The Sign is a decorative furniture item that can store a player-written message. A Sign must be placed and then the ⚷ Interact button must be pressed on it to edit or display its message. A Sign can be placed on top of blocks, beside them, or hanging from their underside. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, Old Chinese version, tModLoader version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, they can also be placed on walls. A Sign's message can be up to 10 lines long, at 48 characters max per line, for a total of 480 characters maximum per sign. Signs can be used for decoration, labeling areas, adventure text, etc. On the Nintendo 3DS version, Signs are limited to 16 characters, with a maximum of 5 numbers, and no punctuation or special symbols can be used.

=== Reaver Shark ===
Description: The Reaver Shark is a pickaxe that can mine any blocks weaker than Hellstone, Demonite or Crimtane ores. On it can also mine Hellstone. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.


=== Huntress armor ===
Description: The Huntress armor is a Hardmode armor set purchased from the Tavernkeep for 450000*45 in total, which consists of the Huntress's Wig, Huntress's Jerkin and Huntress's Pants. A full set of Huntress armor will provide the following stats: Additionally, Explosive Traps' attacks will recharge faster (from every 1.83 seconds to every 1.23 seconds) and have a 1/2 chance to give 4-9 seconds of the Oiled debuff, making enemies take increased damage from On Fire!, Cursed Inferno, Frostburn or Shadowflame. The Red Riding armor is a direct upgrade to this armor set.


=== 1.4.0.5 ===
Description: 1.4.0.5 "Hotfixes" Release date June 4, 2020 Version chronology ← Previous Next → 1.4.0.4 1.4.1 Version history • All patches 1.4.0.5 was a hotfix update for the Desktop version released on June 4, 2020.


=== Bone Pickaxe ===
Description: The Bone Pickaxe is a pickaxe that is capable of mining all ores up to Meteorite / Demonite/Crimtane. It has a 5*1/20 (5%) / 2*1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Undead Miners, uncommon enemies found in the Cavern layer. It is tied with the Silver Pickaxe as the fastest pre-Hardmode pickaxe by mining speed, but has higher pickaxe power equal to that of the Gold Pickaxe, allowing it to mine Meteorite and destroy Dirt Blocks in a single hit. It is the fastest pickaxe for mining weak blocks, such as dirt and snow, until Hardmode, although that function is rendered largely obsolete by the Gravedigger's Shovel. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.


=== Snow Block ===
Description: Snow Blocks are found naturally-placed in the Snow Biome. Snow Blocks placed in the Surface layer, either naturally or by a player, will cause a snowfall effect. This is purely visual, and has no functional effects. Snow Blocks cannot be Hallowed or Corrupted. Snow in any form cannot be melted into water, nor produced from water or ice. Snow blocks are also dropped by the Hardmode Frost Legion enemies, and its Snow Balla throws Snowballs that create further Snow blocks when impacting. Snowfall amount is determined by the number of Snow Blocks that are near your character. The same applies to Snow Bricks, which also cause snowfall. Snow Brick Walls do not cause snowfall on their own.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Snow Block
Ingredients: Ice Block
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation
----------------------------------------
Result: only:Snow Block
Ingredients: Snow Wall4
Crafting Station: Work Bench

=== Alchemy Table ===
Description: The Alchemy Table is a post-Skeletron crafting station used to craft potions. It works almost identically to Placed Bottles when crafting potions, except it has a chance of not consuming ingredients. It can be found randomly in the Dungeon, and in the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version it can also be obtained by fishing in the Dungeon. When a potion is crafted with the Alchemy Table, there is a 33.33*1/3 (33.33%) chance for each ingredient to not be consumed. There is a separate probability check for each of the ingredients used in making the potion, including each of those in a stack. This is effective for gaining more value out of alchemy ingredients, especially of those that are hard to obtain.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Alchemy Table
Ingredients: Bewitching Table
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation

=== Topaz ===
Description: Topaz is a gem found within the Underground and Cavern layers of a world. They are obtained by breaking special blocks that have noticeable yellow-orange gemstones embedded in it. They can also be extracted from Silt, Slush, or Desert Fossil by putting them in an Extractinator. Rarely, Topaz can be found in bulk in its own special gemstone cave, or in one that contains all of the other gems as well (besides Amber). Topaz is the second-least valuable gem available, being able to craft the Sandgun, a type of ranged weapon, along with the rest of the items that usually all gems have counterparts of. Like all other gems, Topaz can be placed on blocks. As of 1.4.0.1, they can be crafted back into their Stony block forms at a Heavy Work Bench in a graveyard and can be obtained by cutting down a topaz Gem Tree, dropping 0-5 of its respective gems.

Ingredients: Sapphire
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation

=== Swordfish ===

=== Titanium Chainsaw ===
Description: The Titanium Chainsaw is a Hardmode chainsaw that is obtainable after crafting an Adamantite Forge or Titanium Forge, and is the chainsaw alternative to the Titanium Waraxe. It is the slightly stronger counterpart to the Adamantite Chainsaw, and is stronger than both the Mythril and Orichalcum Chainsaws, making it the strongest that can be obtained before defeating a Mechanical Boss. Like all Axes and Chainsaws, it is used to cut down Trees, Cacti, and Giant Glowing Mushrooms. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.

=== Jungle Turtle ===
Description: The Jungle Turtle is a critter that only serves as environment flavor and spawns in or near a body of water on the surface Jungle at any time. Due to them having only 5 HP and no defense, they are often killed instantly by enemies or the player itself. It is one of the few critters having no Gold variant. Like its Forest counterpart, it wanders around on land and swim at the surface of water. It can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into a Jungle Turtle Cage to be used as decorative furniture. Once crafted, the caged Jungle Turtle cannot be released again, and when placed down it moves around inside the cage as it would do outside.

=== Tungsten Shortsword ===
Description: The Tungsten Shortsword is an early game metal shortsword. It is slightly more powerful than its Silver version. Like all shortswords, the Tungsten Shortsword has a very limited range and attacks with a stabbing motion at any direction on PC, Console, Mobile, and tModLoader, and horizontally in front of the player on Old-gen console, Windows Phone, Old Chinese, 3DS, and tModLoader Legacy, instead of an arc. This makes it almost useless against flying or jumping enemies, although its high attack rate makes it somewhat effective against weaker fighter type enemies. Unless the player has a good reason to make the Shortsword (like not having very much Tungsten, or for completionist purposes) they are advised to make the Tungsten Broadsword, as it does more damage and can swing in an arc. Its best modifier is Legendary.

Description: The Copper Broadsword is arguably the weakest of the early game metal broadswords. It has a slightly stronger alternate version, the Tin Broadsword. As with all other broadswords, this sword is swung overhead, which makes it easier to defeat flying and jumping monsters than shortswords. This sword is generally more useless than the other early game metal broadswords. There are also other swords that are easier to acquire early game and that deal more damage than this sword, such as the Ebonwood Sword or Shadewood Sword. Its best modifier is Legendary.

=== Inner Tube ===
Description: The Inner Tube is an accessory that causes the player to float on the surface of liquids instead of sinking to the bottom. The effect can be temporarily negated by holding ▼ Down. It can be found in Water Chests, as well as Ocean Crates and Seaside Crates. While wearing the Inner Tube, and floating in water the players fishing power is increased by 5. The Inner Tube's effects are replaced with the Flipper's effect if the player is holding a Trident. Neptune's Shell, its derivative accessories, and Flipper Potion will override the Inner Tube's effects entirely; causing the player to sink.


=== Aqua Scepter ===
Description: The Aqua Scepter is a magic weapon that can be obtained from Locked Gold Chests within the Dungeon, or from Golden Lock Boxes found in Dungeon Crates from fishing. It auto-fires an arc of water particles which can pierce an infinite number of enemies. The Aqua Scepter can be continuously used to keep enemies juggled. However, the sprite of the Aqua Scepter itself deals no damage. Therefore, an enemy too close to the wielder will not get hit by the water, and simply move past the outstretched wand to hit the player. Its best modifier is Mythical.

=== Detonator ===
Description: Detonators are activation Mechanisms that can be found underground as part of Traps, wired to Explosives. They are often found planted on top of suspiciously large veins of underground metals (E.g. Silver). Detonators act as switches, sending an activation trigger to other mechanisms connected to it through Wire. They are tripped either by right-clicking or when a player falls on the plunger, similar to a Pressure Plate. Unlike pressure plates, a player has to actually fall from above to trigger a detonator. Even walking off a 1.5 block high column will not work, while walking off a 2 block high column reliably triggers it. This makes explosive traps that use a detonator instead of a pressure plate slightly less dangerous as they are more difficult to trigger accidentally (as well as much easier to see). A detonator is not triggered by enemies or NPCs falling on it. When triggered by player, a detonator disables itself for one second. When activated by a wire, it is disabled until it is activated by wire again. When it is disabled, plunger is stuck down and it cannot be triggered by a player clicking it or falling on it.


=== Hanging Skeleton ===
Description: The Hanging Skeleton is a decorative furniture item that can be placed on background walls. It can be found in the Dungeon, where they only appear in areas backed by Slab or Tile Walls.


=== Spider Fang ===
Description: Spider Fangs are Hardmode crafting materials dropped by Black Recluses in Spider Caves, which have a 50% (90%) chance to be dropped. These can be used to craft several minion related items and armor. Crafting all items requires 76 Spider Fangs.

=== Fireworks Box ===
Description: The Fireworks Box is a placed novelty mechanism that launches colorful visual effects. Once placed, it can be activated via wire or by right-clicking the Box directly. Each activation causes the Box to fire a random one of four possible fireworks effects that cause no damage. It can be used infinitely at no cost. The Fireworks Box is purchased from the Party Girl for 5.

These walls also do not stop enemies from spawning and cannot be used for proper housing. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, these walls can be crafted from Dirt where they can be used like other craftable walls.

=== Storm Spear ===
Description: The Storm Spear is a desert-themed spear obtainable in pre-Hardmode. When thrust, it fires a Storm Spear Shot, a small bolt of electricity that deals 150% of the spear's base damage and inflicts half its knockback.[1] It can be found in Sandstone Chests in the Underground Desert, as well as in Oasis and Mirage Crates. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.


=== Ninja armor ===
Description: Ninja armor or Ninja set is an armor/vanity set made up of the Ninja Hood, Ninja Shirt and Ninja Pants. King Slime drops each piece separately (1 per kill with a 1:3 chance each), or two pieces from the Treasure Bag it drops in Expert Mode. In the Nintendo 3DS version, pieces of the Ninja set can also be acquired from Lepus, but with only a 3% chance. In all versions though, having the full set equipped grants an after-image movement effect, similar to Shadow, Necro, and Cobalt armors.


=== Meteor armor ===
Description: The Meteor armor is an armor set that consists of the Meteor Helmet, Meteor Suit, and Meteor Leggings. Equipping the full set reduces the mana cost of the Space Gun to 0. In the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, the Gray Zapinator and Orange Zapinator are also affected by this change. Each piece of the armor worn increases magic damage by 9% / 7%. If the full set is visible, the player leaves a trail of flames as they move. Crafting a full set requires a total of 45 / 60 Meteorite Bars (135 / 180 Meteorite ore).

=== Oktoberfest sets ===

=== Blinkroot ===
Description: Blinkroot is a common Herb that grows naturally on Dirt or Mud blocks, regardless of lighting or elevation, so long as there is room for it to grow and the blocks bear no Grass of any kind. It is most commonly found in the Underground Layer and below, due to the general lack of grass in those areas. It can be harvested with any Weapon or Tool. Blinkroot can be planted manually using Blinkroot Seeds, which can also be planted in Clay Pots and Planter Boxes. If the dirt block that the blinkroot is planted on turns into a grass block the blinkroot will break, dropping as an item. Blinkroot emits pulsating light ("blinks") while in bloom. It enters and exits its in-bloom phase randomly, and has no particular blooming requirements. Harvesting it while in-bloom will drop 1-3 Blinkroot Seeds in addition to the Blinkroot item. It is by far the fastest-growing herb in the game, capable of being harvested within seconds of planting. Both Blinkroot and their respective seeds have a chance to be obtained from the Herb Bag.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Garland
Ingredients: DaybloomMoonglowBlinkrootWaterleafDeathweedShiverthornFireblossom
Crafting Station: By Hand
----------------------------------------
Result: Biome Sight Potion
Ingredients: Bottled WaterFireblossomBlinkrootMoonglowGrass Seeds5
Crafting Station: Placed BottleorAlchemy Table


=== Gold Broadsword ===
Description: The Gold Broadsword is the highest tier of early game metal broadswords, being stronger than the Silver Broadsword, yet is slightly weaker than its alternate version, the Platinum Broadsword. Like all broadswords, this sword has an arc motion, which is more useful for killing flying and jumping monsters than shortswords. While it doesn't do much damage, its faster speed means that it is equally if not more powerful than the War Axe of the Night. Its best modifier is Legendary.

=== Chlorophyte Extractinator ===
Description: The Chlorophyte Extractinator is a post-Mech-Boss upgrade to the Extractinator. It is a furniture item that converts Silt, Slush, and Desert Fossils into more valuable items such as ores, coins, and gems, as well as fishing trash into low level bait. The Chlorophyte Extractinator converts items faster, can produce Hardmode ores, and can also exchange Glowing Mosses into all kinds of mosses (except Helium Moss), instead of only regular ones. It can also turn the Corruption, Crimson, and Hallow variants of most blocks into their normal variants, but cannot be used in reverse. Alongside this, it can also be used to convert ores/bars into their alternate ore types (such as Tin being converted into Copper and vice-versa), and Dungeon Bricks into their variants. To use the Chlorophyte Extractinator, it first needs to be placed in the world. Afterward, suitable blocks need to be consumed (with the ⚒ Use / Attack key) directly on the Chlorophyte Extractinator within its 3×3 frame. Holding the Auto Select key and clicking on the Chlorophyte Extractinator will automatically insert extractable items from the player's inventory without having to pick them up manually. Information taken from the PC 1.4.4.6 source code, method ExtractinatorUse() in Terraria.Player.cs. There may be inaccuracies, as the current PC version is 1.4.4.9. Below is a list of items that are guaranteed to be exchanged to another item via the Chlorophyte Extractinator.[1]

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Chlorophyte Extractinator
Ingredients: Chlorophyte Bar18Extractinator
Crafting Station: Mythril AnvilorOrichalcum Anvil

=== Jester's Arrow ===
Description: Jester's Arrows are a type of arrow. They are considered an improvement over the Unholy Arrow, as they have no limit on the number of enemies they can pierce. This makes them efficient against enemies with multiple sections such as the Eater of Worlds. Due to their piercing effect, they can sometimes be better than stronger arrows, such as the Hellfire Arrow. They also emit light when fired, meaning they can be used to temporarily light up caves. However, Jester's Arrows will explode in a firework effect after hitting something or reaching their maximum range. This means that, unlike other arrows, they can not be recovered after hitting an enemy or a wall (As of 1.4, no arrows can be recovered after being fired). In addition to being crafted, Jester's Arrows can also be found in Gold Chests in the Underground and Cavern layers.

Ingredients: Wooden Arrow20Fallen Star
Crafting Station: By Hand

Description: The Magic Hat is an armor item that can be equipped in the helmet slot. The Magic Hat is part of the Wizard set, which further consists of a Mystic Robe or any gem-augmented Robe. It provides a set bonus of +60 mana. The Wizard Hat is an alternative for the helmet slot.

=== Boreal Wood Bow ===
Description: The Boreal Wood Bow is a type of bow crafted from Boreal Wood. It is similar to the Wooden Bow, but it deals 2 more damage and has a higher velocity. Because Snow biomes are usually not too far from the initial spawn point, a Boreal Wood Bow can be a superior alternative to its standard counterpart. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. It can also get the Deadly modifier, which, while the Demonic modifier may provide the greatest damage per hit, grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Boreal Wood Bow
Ingredients: Boreal Wood10
Crafting Station: Work Bench


=== Charm of Myths ===
Description: The Charm of Myths is a Hardmode accessory which combines the effects of the Band of Regeneration and the Philosopher's Stone. When equipped, it regenerates 1 / 0.5 health every second and decreases the duration of the Potion Sickness debuff when consuming potions by 25%. The effect applies the instant a recovery potion is consumed. This allows players to keep the accessory in their inventory or an accessory vanity slot and quickly equip it to heal, then swap it back for another accessory. Potion Sickness is only reduced while the accessory is equipped. Specifically, when equipped, Potion Sickness is multiplied by 0.75, and when unequipped it is divided by 0.75.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Charm of Myths
Ingredients: Band of RegenerationPhilosopher's Stone
Crafting Station: Tinkerer's Workshop


=== Eye Patch ===
Description: The Eye Patch is a vanity item placed in the helmet social slot. It can be dropped by the Pirate Corsair, Pirate Deckhand, Pirate Deadeye, and the Pirate Crossbower with a chance of 0.2*1/500 (0.2%). These enemies can all be found during a Pirate Invasion Event.


=== Gold Bird ===
Description: The Gold Bird is a harmless critter. It is a golden recolor of an ordinary Blue Jay, with a 0.25*1/400 (0.25%) / 0.67*1/150 (0.67%) chance of spawning in place of all types of ordinary birds. Gold Bird has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players. Gold Bird can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gold Bird Cage). Once crafted, the Gold Bird cannot be released again. Gold Bird itself or the crafted furniture can be sold for 10. It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

Ingredients: TerrariumGold Bird

Ingredients: Gold Bird
Crafting Station: Cooking PotorCauldron


=== Coral ===
Description: Corals are crafting materials which can be found in the Ocean biomes at the ends of the world. They grow naturally on Sand Blocks underwater and within 250 tiles of the edges of the map and above the depth of −10 feet / 0 feet, as long as no more than 5 Corals are within a 7-tile range. Corals can be harvested either with a pickaxe/drill, by mining out the sand underneath them, or by placing a block above them. Corals can be placed for decoration and will have one of many appearances, much like Seashells. Corals will spawn slower on sand under less than 5 tiles of water. Spawn rates scale with rain, wind and empty space up to 14 tiles above the Sand Block. Corals will only spawn on sand under at least 5 tiles of water. Rain and wind do not affect spawn rates.

=== Orichalcum Bar ===
Description: Orichalcum Bars are Hardmode bars crafted from 4 Orichalcum Ore each. They are necessary to make the Orichalcum Anvil, which is needed to create most Hardmode equipment, and is the equivalent to the Mythril Anvil, thus, making Orichalcum equivalent to Mythril. Crafting all Orichalcum equipment, including the anvil, requires 186 Orichalcum Bars, or a total of 744 Orichalcum Ore. Without the anvil, 174 bars, or 696 ore, will be needed.

=== Frost Staff ===
Description: The Frost Staff is a Hardmode magic weapon that has a 2*1/50 (2%) drop chance from Icy Mermen and Ice Elementals, both of which are found in the Snow biome or Ice biome. The Frost Staff shoots a frost bolt which travels in a straight line, pierces a single enemy, and disappears after striking a second. Its best modifier is Mythical.


=== Eternia Crystal ===
Description: The Eternia Crystal is an event-summoning item. When used in the Eternia Crystal Stand, the Old One's Army event begins. The Eternia Crystal is purchased from the Tavernkeep for 25 (pre-mechanical bosses), 1 (post-mechanical bosses), or 4 (post-Golem).


=== Heart ===
Description: Hearts (or Candy Apples during Halloween and Candy Canes during Christmas) are common power-ups which can be dropped by slain enemies (with a chance of 1/12 (8.3%), as long as the player is below maximum health), broken Pots, or as bonus drops from slimes. They are not inventory items, but are instead instantly consumed and restore 20 health. Enemies will only drop Hearts if the closest player is not at maximum health. They emit a faint red light. It is also possible to spawn Hearts (and their seasonal counterparts) with a Heart Statue. Hearts can be collected within a range of 2 blocks, which can be increased with a Heartreach Potion.


=== Azure Crate ===
Description: The Azure Crate is a Hardmode crate that can only be fished at high elevations, such as in Floating Lakes. Azure Crates contain items found in standard crates, and they always contain an item normally found in Skyware Chests. Although Skyware Chests can rarely contain the Sky Mill, the Azure Crate never does. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Sky Crate. As of 1.4.4, it can now yield cloud blocks, finally making them renewable.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Sky Crate
Ingredients: Azure Crate
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation


=== Summoning Potion ===
Description: The Summoning Potion is a buff potion which grants the Summoning buff when consumed. It increases the player's max number of minions by one. This lasts for 8 minutes, but can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon ( ), by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu ( ), by double-tapping the buff icon ( ), or by canceling the buff from the buffs screen ().

=== Vial of Blood ===
Description: The Vial of Blood is a pet-summoning item that spawns a pet Bat when used. It grants the player the Pet Bat buff that lasts until the player manually cancels the buff or dies. The pet bat flies around the player, dealing 2-4 damage to enemies it happens to touch, and can travel through all blocks. When a player is in a body of water, the bat will fly above it like any other type of bat. When the pet bat gets too far from the player, it can fly back instead of shooting back with clouds behind it. The Vial of Blood is an uncommon drop from Vampire Miners. It can also rarely be obtained from Gold Chests and Ivy Chests.

=== Luminite Axes ===
Description: Luminite Axes are four tools. The four types are the Solar Flare Axe, Vortex Axe, Nebula Axe, and the Stardust Axe, each themed after a different Celestial Tower. They are all unable to be crafted, and instead the player must craft the Luminite Hamaxes. Even with Terrasavr and some other inventory editors, they seem to disappear, leaving an empty slot. Their best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

=== Flaming Arrow ===
Description: Flaming Arrows are a type of arrow. They are an upgrade to the Wooden Arrow, dealing slightly more damage and having a chance to inflict the On Fire! debuff on enemies. They are fairly easy to craft, requiring only Torches and Wooden Arrows. Flaming Arrows emit light when fired or dropped, making them useful for temporary lighting in a cave. However, they will not emit light if fired into water. Flaming Arrows are recoverable after hitting a wall or enemy 1/3 of the time, but only 1/3 of those that do remain lit; the rest drop as Wooden Arrows. Wooden Arrows fired from the Molten Fury behave similarly and have a chance to be recovered as Flaming Arrows.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: only:Flaming Arrow10
Ingredients: Wooden Arrow10Torch
Crafting Station: By Hand


=== Yellow Horseshoe Balloon ===
Description: The Yellow Horseshoe Balloon is an accessory that grants immunity to fall damage, increases jump height by 75%, and grants a double-jump. The height of the first jump is increased from 6 blocks to 10½ blocks, while the double-jump's height is increased from 15 blocks to 26½ blocks, reaching a total of 37 blocks with both jumps. Jump height is instead reduced by 15% when underwater, reducing your total underwater height from 27 blocks (8 + 19 from Sandstorm jump) to 22 blocks (7 + 15 from Sandstorm jump).

=== Chippy's Couch ===

=== Sun Mask ===
Description: The Sun Mask is a vanity helmet dropped by Lamias in normal Underground Deserts with a 4*1/25 (4%) chance.


=== Magic Lantern ===
Description: The Magic Lantern is a light pet item that summons a small glowing lantern which hovers above the player, emitting dim light. The lantern will also expose all treasure within up to 15 tiles from the lantern's location, overlaying sparkles over nearby treasure. It is purchased from the Skeleton Merchant for 10, during the night of a full moon. The lantern will always try to maintain a position just forward of and above the player, passing through blocks as needed. If the player gets far enough away, the lantern will propel itself with a rocket exhaust in order to catch up. The lantern's position can block objects of interest at ceiling height, but if the player just turns around, the lantern will move to their other side.


=== Fake Unicorn Horn ===
Description: The Fake Unicorn Horn is a vanity accessory purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 250.

The Meteor falls in the direction of the cursor, damaging nearby enemies upon colliding with a block. They cannot pass through solid objects, but may pass through platforms. It also emits light particles which continue traveling after the impact. Its best modifier is Mythical.

=== Electrosphere Launcher ===
Description: The Electrosphere Launcher is a Hardmode, post-Golem launcher that fires rockets to the position of the cursor, then forms an energy-emanating ball of constant damage for approximately 8 seconds. An infinite number of electrospheres can be summoned, but they cannot overlap. The Electrosphere Launcher has a 16.67*1/6 (16.67%) / 11.11*1/9 (11.11%) chance to be dropped by the Martian Saucer during the Martian Madness event. Its best modifier is Unreal.


=== Spore Sac ===
Description: The Spore Sac is a Hardmode accessory that is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Plantera in Expert Mode. When equipped, it continuously spawns multiple stationary floating spores around the player that act as homing mines. When an enemy comes within range, they slowly swarm the enemy and cause small explosions on contact, dealing about 400 damage over 1 second. Spores have the ability to pass through blocks to reach enemies, and will inflict the Poisoned debuff. They have a small area-effect that can hit multiple targets. Spores can only spawn near blocks, or on background walls, that are up to 25 tiles away from the player. Flying in open areas (eg. via Wings or Mounts) with no walls or blocks in range will not result in any spores spawned. When spawning near blocks, with no background walls, only a single layer of spores spawns, floating within about 3 tiles of the blocks. On background walls, spores can spawn anywhere in mid-air.


=== Bladed Glove ===
Description: The Bladed Glove is a rare fast-hitting melee weapon with a very short range that can drop only during the Halloween seasonal event. It can be a very effective weapon when fighting pre-Hardmode melee enemies due to the high speed, and therefore, damage output. The Fetid Baghnakhs can be considered its Hardmode upgrade. Its best modifier is Legendary. The Bladed Glove has a 0.05*1/2000 (0.05%) chance of being dropped by any weak enemy during the Halloween seasonal event. Weak enemies are enemies with less than 20 defense, 40 damage and up to 5 of loot. These will be mostly pre hardmode enemies. When playing in expert mode all enemies are much stronger and therefore these conditions limit the number of enemies that can drop the Bloody Machete and Bladed Glove to just a couple, especially during hardmode. See the table below for clarification.


=== Wrenches ===
Description: Wrenches are tools for placing Wire. Wires are used to connect mechanisms together, such as a trap with a Pressure Plate. All Wrenches are purchased from the Mechanic for 2 each. Holding a wrench allows players to see laid wires. Wires exist in their own layer, and thus can be placed over furniture, blocks, and walls. There are currently four different Wrenches: the Red Wrench, Green Wrench, Blue Wrench, and the Yellow Wrench, each placing its respective color of Wire. All Wrenches use the same ordinary Wire item as ammunition, but the color of Wrench used will determine the color of wire when placed. The colors all function identically, but can be placed so as to overlap or intersect each other without interfering with each other. Junction Boxes can further be used to keep intersecting Wire paths of the same color from interfering with each other. All four wrenches can be combined to make a Multicolor Wrench, a single tool that can place Wire of any color. Ordinary Wrenches cannot be used to remove placed wires. Instead, a Wire Cutter, or one of its derivatives (Multicolor Wrench, Grand Design) is required. All Wire colors become the same ordinary Wire item again when freed.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Multicolor Wrench
Ingredients: Red WrenchGreen WrenchBlue WrenchYellow WrenchWire Cutter
Crafting Station: Tinkerer's Workshop


=== Silt Block ===
Description: Silt Blocks are a type of soil that are very similar to Sand Blocks that start appearing from the underground surface (very rarely). Silt is affected by gravity and will deal damage to any player or enemy they fall on. Unlike sand, it can stop the Hallow, the Crimson, and the Corruption from spreading. It looks similar to Ash Blocks, but is a lighter color. Silt can be placed on an Extractinator to spawn various valuable materials, including gems, coins, ores, and very rarely, the Amber Mosquito pet summoning item.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Gray Stucco10
Ingredients: Silt BlockStone Block10
Crafting Station: Furnace

=== Torch God's Favor ===
Description: Torch God's Favor is a consumable item obtained by surviving The Torch God event. Upon use, it permanently grants the player the ability to automatically convert regular Torches and Campfires in the player's hand to the current biome's Torch/Campfire variant, which positively influences the player's luck in most areas. Torch God's Favor is a one-time consumable whose effect cannot stack (similar to Advanced Combat Techniques or the Demon Heart). When first used, the ability is switched on by default. It can then be toggled off and on via a biome torch swap icon appearing in the upper-left of the inventory (similar to The Grand Design). Torches placed with biome torch swap toggled on will permanently remain converted to the biome torch they were placed as, even if freed and picked up. Here's the list of torches/campfires and their respective biomes:

=== Sandcastle Bucket ===
Description: The Sandcastle Bucket is a tool that places a decorative sandcastle and consumes one Sand Block upon use. It can be used on all variants of Sand Blocks and platforms, in any biome. Sandcastles are background furniture objects, but they cannot be picked up; using a pickaxe or drill on them destroys them immediately. The Sandcastle Bucket can be found randomly in Water Chests, Ocean Crates, and Seaside Crates. When the cursor is moved over a valid block, one out of four sandcastle styles will be selected randomly. Moving the cursor over a different block will produce a different sandcastle preview, so players can choose the particular sandcastle variant they wish to place by moving their cursor back and forth.


=== Mime Mask ===
Description: The Mime Mask is a vanity item equipped in the Social Helmet slot. It is purchased from the Clothier during a Blood Moon for 2. The game does not display the Mime Mask as a vanity item.


=== Fallen Tuxedo set ===
Description: The Fallen Tuxedo set is a set of Vanity items made up of the Fallen Tuxedo Shirt and the Fallen Tuxedo Pants. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance. They are purchased from the Clothier for 50 (set), during a Blood Moon.


=== Pirate Map ===
Description: The Pirate Map is a Hardmode item used to summon a Pirate Invasion. It has a 1% (1/100) chance of dropping from any enemy killed by the player within or close to an Ocean during Hardmode.


=== Pink Horseshoe Balloon ===
Description: The Pink Horseshoe Balloon is an accessory that grants immunity to fall damage, increases jump height by 33% and jump speed by 30%, and grants a double jump. The height of the first jump is increased from 6 blocks to 10½ blocks (~75% increase), while the double jump's height is increased from 7 blocks to 13 blocks, reaching a total of 23½ blocks with both jumps. Jump height is oddly reduced when underwater, reducing your total underwater height from 17½ blocks (8 blocks + 9½ blocks from Tsunami jump) to 15 blocks (7 blocks + 8 blocks from Tsunami jump).

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Pink Horseshoe Balloon
Ingredients: Sharkron BalloonLucky Horseshoe
Crafting Station: Tinkerer's Workshop


=== Neptune's Shell ===
Description: Neptune's Shell is a Hardmode accessory that aids performance underwater (and in other liquids) by granting indefinite breathing time underwater, swimming via the ↷ Jump key, and eliminating the slow movement speed usually caused by water. Entering water with this accessory equipped transforms the player into Merfolk form. While in this form, the breath meter will not display (nor will it decrease), therefore effectively preventing drowning. Neptune's Shell can be considered an upgrade from the Diving Gear in most respects, but lacks the extra mobility on ice of the Arctic Diving Gear and the extra lighting underwater of the Jellyfish Necklace.

Crafting Recipes:

Ingredients: Soul of Fright20Coral15Goldfish15Shark Fin5Soul of Light5Soul of Night5
Crafting Station: Mythril AnvilorOrichalcum Anvil


=== Flask of Cursed Flames ===
Description: The Flask of Cursed Flames is a Hardmode flask that, when applied, causes melee weapons (and Whips) to inflict the Cursed Inferno[1] debuff for 3–6 seconds on a successful hit. Melee weapons that fire projectiles will also inflict the debuff on enemies hit by the projectiles. The Flask of Cursed Flames cannot be used in conjunction with other flasks, and using it will remove any existing flask effects. However, like other flasks, the effect will last across death. The Flask of Cursed Flames will not inflict the Cursed Flames debuff in PvP scenarios.

Ingredients: Bottled WaterCursed Flame5
Crafting Station: Imbuing Station


=== Cobalt Pickaxe ===
Description: The Cobalt Pickaxe is a Hardmode pickaxe, and is the pickaxe alternative to the Cobalt Drill, having a slower mining speed but longer range and benefiting from mining speed bonuses. Its alternate ore version, the Palladium Pickaxe, is slightly stronger than the Cobalt Pickaxe. It can mine any block except Adamantite Ore, Titanium Ore, Chlorophyte Ore, and Lihzahrd Bricks. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

=== Chain Knife ===
Description: The Chain Knife is a melee weapon that throws a Knife-like projectile attached to a chain, similar to Flails, but the attack button cannot be held to wield it continuously. It only extends a short distance of 12 tiles, though its quick use time and velocity may make it a good early to mid-game weapon. It has a 0.4*1/250 (0.4%) chance of being dropped by a Cave Bat. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.

=== Broken Hero Sword ===
Description: The Broken Hero sword is a Post-Plantera Hardmode crafting material. On the PC, Console, Mobile, Old Chinese, tModLoader, and tModLoader Legacy versions, it has a 25*1/4 (25%) / 43.75*7/16 (43.75%) chance of being dropped by Mothron. On the Old-gen console, Windows Phone, and 3DS versions, it instead has a 0.4*1/250 (0.4%) chance of being dropped by Frankensteins and Swamp Things. It is not a weapon itself, and therefore can neither be swung, reforged, nor placed on a Weapon Rack.

=== Obsidian Horseshoe ===

It grants immunity to the burning damage inflicted by meteorite and hellstone blocks, while granting immunity to fall damage. However, it does not provide the extra 1 point of defense that the Obsidian Skull does.

=== Stellar Tune ===
Description: The Stellar Tune is a Hardmode, post-Plantera magic weapon with a 2*1/50 (2%) / 5*1/20 (5%) chance to be dropped by the Empress of Light. It fires pairs of star-shaped projectiles that travel in a wave-like pattern towards the cursor. Said projectiles home on enemies, pass through solid blocks, and explode in a small radius on impact. It plays an acoustic guitar chord when fired, based on the distance between the player and the cursor (in a similar fashion to the Magical Harp). There are a total of six chords: each one spans about a four-block distance from the player, except for the last one, which is played at a distance of 21 blocks or more. The distance from the player to the cursor also controls the speed at which projectiles are fired. However, if the projectiles are seeking an enemy, they will instead determine their speed based on the distance to that enemy. The Stellar Tune has similarities to Ocram's second form laser attacks. Its best modifier is Mythical.


=== Bouncy Glowstick ===

=== Prismatic Lacewing ===
Description: The Prismatic Lacewing is a rare flying critter that spawns in the surface Hallow from dusk (7:30 PM) until midnight (12:00 AM) after Plantera has been defeated. When killed by a player, it summons the Empress of Light; death from non-player sources other than Fallen Stars will not result in summoning. The Prismatic Lacewing can be caught with a Bug Net. Releasing it from the inventory (with ⚒ Use / Attack) and killing it will still summon the Empress of Light (though it will quickly disappear if released outside of the Hallow). Only one Lacewing can be naturally spawned at a time. It can also be used to craft a Prismatic Lacewing Jar. It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades. The Bestiary entry for the Prismatic Lacewing: "Should one of these luminescent beings perish in the chaos of night, a sleeping tyrant is rumored to violently awaken."

=== Musket ===
Description: The Musket is one of the earliest obtainable guns. It fires / autofires bullets at a very slow rate. The Musket (along with 100 Musket Balls) will always drop from the first Shadow Orb destroyed in a Corruption world; thereafter, it has a 20*1/5 (20%) chance of dropping from a destroyed Shadow Orb. It can also be found in Corrupt and Defiled Crates obtained by fishing in the Corruption, with a 16.67*1/6 (16.67%) chance. Its Crimson counterpart is The Undertaker. Its best modifier is Unreal.


=== Cockatiels ===
Description: Gray Cockatiels and Yellow Cockatiels are critters. As all other critters, they have 5 health, no defense, and are often killed instantly by other enemies or the player. They can spawn in the Jungle between 4:30 AM and 7:30 PM along with other jungle birds, and can be heard chirping when nearby. Similar to other Birds, Cockatiels will not move until approached, where they will fly away. Cockatiels can be caught with a Bug Net or its upgrades and be carried in the inventory where it can be released, destroyed, or used for crafting.

=== Fireblossom Seeds ===
Description: Fireblossom Seeds are a type of seed that can be obtained from harvesting Fireblossoms while they are blooming or using the Staff of Regrowth on naturally grown Fireblossoms while they are fully grown. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, Old Chinese version, tModLoader version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, a Fireblossom will bloom when the sun is setting if it is not raining, from 3:45 PM to 7:30 PM. On the Old-gen console version, Windows Phone version, and Nintendo 3DS version, Fireblossom plants must be at least partially submerged in lava before they will bloom and yield seeds. Each plant will drop 1–3 Fireblossom Seeds when harvested while blooming. Fireblossom Seeds can be placed on Ash Blocks, empty Clay Pots, or any types of Planter Boxes, even inside lava, and will grow into harvestable Fireblossoms. They will grow anywhere, not just in the Underworld, but will only yield seeds when blooming. Like the Fireblossom, this item is not destroyed when coming into contact with lava, despite having a rarity of 00*.


=== Obsidian Skull Rose ===
Description: The Obsidian Skull Rose is an accessory crafted from the Obsidian Skull and Obsidian Rose that combines their functionality, granting immunity to fire blocks and reduced damage from lava. The Obsidian Skull Rose can be worn in a Social Accessory Slot as a vanity item.

=== Petri Dish ===
Description: The Petri Dish summons a pet slime when used, which deals no damage. It grants the Pet Slime buff that lasts until the player manually cancels it by pressing X or X/Square on the buff's icon in the armor section of the inventory screen, uses the Petri Dish again, or the player dies. It can be obtained from Gold Chests and as a drop from Shadow Slimes.


=== Nettle Burst ===
Description: The Nettle Burst is a Hardmode magic weapon that fires a 24-tile-long snaking vine projection that lingers for several seconds, traveling through blocks and infinitely piercing enemies. It is an upgrade of the Vilethorn and Crystal Vile Shard, having a 14.29*1/7 (14.29%) / 16.67*1/6 (16.67%) chance to be dropped by Plantera. The Nettle Burst scores a rapid succession of up to 9 hits on enemies (compared to the Vilethorn's 7 hits). Each hit delivers the weapon's full damage, or over 250 damage total on any enemy that remains in its affected area for its full duration. Like the Vilethorn, the Nettle Burst produces minuscule knockback for each of its rapid hits. This tends to have the effect of nearly freezing enemies in place for the duration of each swing. Enemies that are immune to knockback do not have their movement impeded. Like the Crystal Vile Shard, the Nettle Burst ignores up to 10 of the target's defense. Its best modifier is Mythical.


=== Nebula Blaze ===
Description: The Nebula Blaze is a Hardmode, post-Lunatic Cultist magic weapon which auto-fires pink, high-velocity projectiles that home in on enemies if they are nearby, with a 20*1/5 (20%) chance to fire a larger, faster blue projectile that does three times the damage and has a higher velocity, instead. The Nebula Blaze fires inaccurately, akin to the Chain Gun and similar weapons – however, its projectiles are homing from a certain angle, similar to the Spectre Staff. When selected, it appears as a pink glow covering the player's hand which leaves behind a pink particle trail as the player moves. Its best modifier is Mythical.

=== Tentacle Spike ===
Description: The Tentacle Spike is a pre-Hardmode melee weapon dropped by the Eater of Souls, Devourer, Crimera, Face Monster, and Blood Crawler with a 0.19*1/525 (0.19%) chance. On The Constant seed, the drop chance is increased to a 1*1/100 (1%) chance. Similar to the Daybreak; the Tentacle Spike embeds the Tentacle Spike projectile into an enemy on a hit, each dealing 3 damage every second. These spikes last for 9 seconds, and can stack up to 5 times on each target, leading to a total of 15 damage every second with all spikes embedded. Its best modifier is Legendary.

Sky Crates contain items found in standard crates, and on the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, they always contain an item normally found in Skyware Chests. On the Old Chinese version and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, Sky Crates only have a chance to drop an item from a Skyware Chest, but they may also drop Hardmode bars if opened in a Hardmode world. Although Skyware Chests can rarely contain the Sky Mill, the Sky Crate never does. Its Hardmode counterpart is the Azure Crate.
