=== Wolf set ===
Description: The Wolf set is a vanity set that has a 3.51*2/57 (3.51%) chance to be dropped by Goodie Bags, which are collected during Halloween with a 1.25*1/80 (1.25%) chance.


=== Titanium Ore ===
Description: Titanium Ore is a Hardmode ore which can possibly replace Adamantite in a given world and is functionally the same. Titanium, like all Hardmode ores, is generated upon destruction of an Altar with a Pwnhammer or higher. Like Adamantite, a Mythril Drill/Orichalcum Drill (or their pickaxe equivalents) with 150% Pickaxe power or better is required to mine it. On the Nintendo 3DS version, it can also be mined with a Palladium Drill. Titanium Ore, as well as Titanium Bars, can also be obtained by opening Crates, eliminating the need for a higher-tier pickaxe.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Titanium Ore
Ingredients: Chlorophyte Ore
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation


=== Kwad Racer Drone ===
Description: The Kwad Racer Drone is a post-Plantera novelty item purchased from the Cyborg for 10. Pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack button while selected in the hotbar summons a harmless drone that can be controlled by the ▲ Up, ◀ Left, and ▶ Right buttons. Pressing ⚒ Use / Attack again or switching to another item instantly destroys the drone. The player also appears to wield a remote control when in use. The player is locked in place while the drone is active. Equipping the FPV Goggles will center the camera on the drone.


=== Deathweed Seeds ===
Description: Deathweed Seeds are a type of seed that can be obtained from harvesting Deathweeds while they are blooming. A Deathweed plant only blooms during a Blood Moon, and also during Full Moons in the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, Old Chinese version, tModLoader version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version. Its blooming state can be identified by the sickly red pods on its leaves. Each plant will drop 1–3 Deathweed Seeds when harvested while blooming. The Staff of Regrowth can't be used to harvest the herb or seeds while not in bloom. Deathweed Seeds can be placed on Corrupt and Crimson grass, Ebonstone and Crimstone Blocks, empty Clay Pots, or any types of Planter Boxes, and will grow into harvestable Deathweeds. They will grow anywhere, not just in the evil biomes, but will only yield seeds when blooming.

=== Betsy's Wrath ===
Description: Betsy's Wrath is a Hardmode magic weapon which is dropped by Betsy during the Old One's Army event. Using the weapon fires 3 fireballs that arc through the air, exploding upon impact. Any enemies hit will receive the Betsy's Curse debuff for 10 seconds, lowering defense by 40. The debuff cannot be applied to other players. Its best modifier is Mythical.


=== Ham Bat ===
Description: The Ham Bat is an early-Hardmode melee weapon that has a 4*1/25 (4%) chance to drop from Pigrons. On The Constant seed, the drop chance is increased to 10*1/10 (10%). Killing an enemy with the Ham Bat grants the Hearty Meal buff, which increases the player's health regeneration by 3 per second.[1] This lasts for 7 seconds, but can be canceled at any time by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu () or by double-tapping the buff icon (). Hearty Meal will not stack upon killing another enemy; the duration instead resets. The Ham Bat's damage is slightly increased if a food buff is active;[2] see the table on the right. Its best modifier is Legendary.

It can be found by destroying Shadow Orbs in the Underground Corruption or from Corrupt or Defiled Crates. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, it can furthermore be crafted, and on the Nintendo 3DS version, it can be found in Living Trees.

=== Raven Staff ===
Description: The Raven Staff is a Hardmode, post-Plantera summon weapon. It spawns a Raven minion that chases enemies and deals contact damage. Like other minions, the summoned Ravens is invincible and follows the player for an unlimited amount of time, unless the player dies, summons a replacement minion, cancels the buff, or leaves the world. It is dropped from Pumpking during the Pumpkin Moon event with a chance of 1.79% – 14.29%, depending on the wave. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Raven Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.


=== Pin Wheel ===
Description: The Pin Wheel is a novelty furniture. When placed, the wheel spins if it is windy, with its spin speed depending on the current wind speed in the area. It is purchased from the Merchant for 20 during the Windy Day event.


=== Fez ===
Description: The Fez is a head vanity item purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 350.


=== Shadow Orb (item) ===
Description: The Shadow Orb is a light pet item that summons a slow-moving Shadow Orb which follows the player around and emits dim, purple light. The orb can move through solid objects and liquids unhindered, but moves very slowly, causing it to fall behind when the player is moving quickly. If it falls far enough behind, it will teleport to the player's location. It has a 20*1/5 (20%) chance of dropping from destroyed Shadow Orbs, but it can also be acquired by looting Corrupt Crates, which are obtained by fishing in the Corruption. The Crimson counterpart to the Shadow Orb is the Crimson Heart.


=== Mythril Ore ===
Description: Mythril Ore is a Hardmode ore that appears in the world every two out of three Demon Altars or Crimson Altars that have been destroyed. Note that its equivalent, Orichalcum Ore, may spawn instead. Mythril Ore is found throughout the Cavern layer as well as in most Hardmode Crates. It requires a pickaxe power of 110 to mine (Cobalt/Palladium pickaxe or better, or any drill). To craft all Mythril equipment, a total of 155 Bars (or 620 Ore) is required.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Mythril Ore
Ingredients: Orichalcum Ore
Crafting Station: Chlorophyte Extractinator Conversion


=== Starlight ===
Description: The Starlight is a Hardmode melee weapon that has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance to be dropped by the Empress of Light boss. While the ⚒ Use / Attack button is held, short-range light beams fire rapidly, at no mana or ammo cost. Its best modifier is Legendary.


=== Laser Rifle ===
Description: The Laser Rifle is a Hardmode magic weapon that auto-fires violet lasers which penetrate up to two enemies and emit moderate light. It has a 12.5*1/8 (12.5%) / 25*1/4 (25%) chance to be dropped by the Wall of Flesh. Despite its name, it does not count as a gun, cannot receive ranged weapon modifiers, and will not fulfill the requirements for the Arms Dealer to move in. The Laser Rifle can be considered an upgrade of the Space Gun, although the set bonus effect of Meteor armor does not apply to it. Its best modifier is Mythical.

=== Ballista sentry summons ===
Description: The Ballista Rod, Cane, and Staff are special sentry summon weapons. They can summon the Ballista sentry, which lasts for 10 minutes / 2 minutes , remains stationary, and does not count against the player's minion capacity. Each Ballista sentry is a large automated crossbow device on the ground that fires piercing spears at approaching enemies. The Rod is sold by the Tavernkeep for 50000*5 , the Cane for 150000*15 , and Staff for 600000*60 . The Rod is always available. The Cane becomes available after defeating one Mechanical Boss, and the Staff becomes available after defeating Golem. The three different versions cause an identical effect, but with varying statistics, with the Staff being the most expensive and the most powerful. These weapons can only be used outside of the Old One's Army event after the event has been successfully completed. Completing the event on any difficulty allows Rods, Canes, and Staves alike to be used outside of the event. During the Old One's Army event, Etherian Mana can be collected, which allows the placement of multiple Ballistas that remain permanently until the event is over. Etherian Mana cannot be used outside the event. Ballista sentries are boosted by the Squire armor and Valhalla Knight armor set bonuses, which increase the velocity of the ballista projectiles, increase penetration from 4 to 7, and grant Ballista Panic! when the player takes damage. Ballista Panic! doubles the fire rate of Ballista sentries for 5 seconds after taking damage. Additionally, the Valhalla Knight armor increases the firing rate from every 3 seconds to every 1.66 seconds. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier presents a wider array of stat bonuses, but most of these apply to the initial summoning, and not to the resulting Ballista. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only significant advantage the Mythical modifier has over Ruthless is in knockback.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Ballista Cane
Ingredients: Flameburst Cane
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation


=== Bamboo Leaf ===
Description: The Bamboo Leaf is a pet-summoning item that summons a Baby Red Panda. It is purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 1. When far enough away, the Baby Red Panda will ride a flying bamboo to catch up to the player.

=== Tome of Infinite Wisdom ===
Description: The Tome of Infinite Wisdom is a Hardmode magic weapon which is dropped by Ogre mini-boss during the Old One's Army event. When fired, it auto-fires four high-velocity pages that do not pierce. ⚷ Interact summons a tornado which can pierce enemies, travels through one-block low roofs, lasts four seconds, and will be stopped by a wall. If used while moving on a flying mount, its pages spread out. Its best modifier is Mythical.


=== Bomb Fish ===
Description: Bomb Fish are explosives obtained through fishing. They act as Sticky Bombs, sticking to any blocks that they are thrown at.


=== Spider Staff ===
Description: The Spider Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon. It spawns a spider minion that follows the player and attacks by latching on to enemies. If enough of them attack the same enemy, it can be stun-locked. The spiders inflict the Acid Venom debuff for 2-4 seconds, can climb background walls, and jump high. Like other minions, the summoned Spider is invincible and follows the player for an unlimited amount of time, unless the player dies, summons a replacement minion, cancels the buff, or leaves the world. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Spider Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback. Interestingly, the Ruthless modifier on the spider staff grants it +19% damage, rather than +18% damage.

=== Rolling Cactus ===
Description: The Rolling Cactus is a placeable object that behaves similarly to the Boulder. It is stationary when placed, and begins to move when hit by projectiles, pickaxes, or drills, or when the blocks under it are mined or hammered. Its roll direction is determined by whether its horizontal position in the world is an odd or even number, regardless of the slope of the surface it is on (unless it is blocked on one side by blocks, in which case it rolls in the other direction). When both blocks under a Rolling Cactus are removed or hammered into a half-block, it will drop vertically until it hits a surface, then bounce and roll. A Rolling Cactus projectile pierces an unlimited number of entities. When a Rolling Cactus that has already started rolling falls onto a lower surface, it maintains its forward momentum while bouncing back up, releasing 2–4 Rolling Cactus Spikes that travel in random directions. Hitting a vertical obstacle also releases Spikes, but destroys the Rolling Cactus. A Rolling Cactus' movement is affected by liquids, and it can roll uphill. A stationary Rolling Cactus deals 21–29 damage when a player touches it.[1] A Rolling Cactus projectile deals 76–104 / 152–280 / 228–312 damage to players (38–52 damage to NPCs, enemies, and critters) and deals a knockback of 10 (Extremely strong) on contact.[2] Each Rolling Cactus Spike deals 51–69 / 102–138 / 153–207 damage to players (26–34 damage to NPCs, enemies, and critters), deals a knockback of 2 (Very weak), pierces entities, and breaks on contact with blocks.[3]

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Rolling Cactus
Ingredients: Cactus6
Crafting Station: Heavy Work Bench and Ecto Mist


=== The Grand Design ===
Description: The Grand Design is a tool for working with wiring and mechanisms. It combines and extends the abilities of its components: It allows a controlled view of wiring (Mechanical Lens), and allows the player to place or remove any color of wire (Multicolor Wrench); unlike its components, it also shows and works with Actuators. It also provides the Ruler's ability to measure distances and relative positions. Creating the Grand Design costs 1410 in total. All of its components can be bought from the Mechanic. Given the requirements of crafting The Grand Design, it can only be created after Skeletron has been defeated. The Grand Design can be used at any part of the screen, regardless of block placement range. When pressing ⚷ Interact with the tool, a small menu will pop up at the cursor's position with six different buttons in a radial pattern. The outside buttons can be used to select which wire colors (including Actuators) can be interacted with, and the middle button will toggle between placing or harvesting the designated wires. In addition, as long as The Grand Design is anywhere in the inventory, seven buttons will appear on the left-hand side of the screen, controlling whether to display the ruler or not and whether to highlight actuators and/or the four different colors of wires. You can also toggle between Forced and Regular wire visibility (Forced always shows wires, Regular only shows wires when holding The Grand Design).

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: only:The Grand Design
Ingredients: Multicolor WrenchMechanical LensMechanical RulerWire60
Crafting Station: Tinkerer's Workshop

Description: The Mouse is a critter and cannot harm players. However, unlike most critters, they cannot be harmed by monsters. Mice have only 5 health. They spawn in Underground and Cavern layers. Their small size and speed can make them difficult to spot even in well-lit conditions, although they occasionally squeak. Unlike most other critters, NPCs will prevent mice from spawning. Rarely, a Gold Mouse may spawn instead of a normal one. Mice can be captured with any Bug Net.

=== Firefly ===
Description: The Firefly is a critter that gives off a tiny amount of light. Fireflies have only 5 health, and can be damaged by other enemies and the player, which almost always results in their instant death. Fireflies will spawn anywhere with clear weather on the surface at night, except inside houses. They can be caught with a Bug Net to be carried around and released later, or put in a bottle to be used as furniture and a light source. The bottled firefly is animated and moves around inside, and cannot be released once crafted. Fireflies can be used as bait, having a 20% bait power value.

=== Mrs. Claus set ===

=== War Table ===
Description: The War Table is an animated furniture item that is dropped by the Dark Mage during the Old One's Army event. During the last Tier 1 wave, it has a 50*1/2 (50%) / 100*1/1 (100%) chance to drop; during the fourth and sixth Tier 3 waves, it has a 12.5*1/8 (12.5%) / 25*1/4 (25%) chance to drop. Placing and pressing ⚷ Interact on the War Table grants the Strategist buff, which increases the player's sentry capacity by 1. This lasts until the player dies or leaves the world, but can be canceled at any time. This lasts for 0 seconds, but can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon ( ), by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu (), or by double-tapping the buff icon ().. Unlike equipment buff items, the War Table must be placed in order to activate the buff. It can be mined with a pickaxe or drill and picked up again, even while the buff is active, which will not cancel the buff. Placement is only dependent on an adequate space of 5×4 tiles being available.


=== Flying Knife ===
Description: The Flying Knife is a unique Hardmode melee weapon that has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance to be dropped by the Hallowed Mimic. It throws a reusable cursor-controllable projectile similar to the Magic Missile mechanic, though more erratic and with no mana cost. Like boomerangs, the projectile returns to the player. Holding the ⚒ Use / Attack button after use directs the projectile's general path, although it also continuously moves on its own and ricochets off blocks. As such, it may require a little practice to be used properly. It returns to the player when the ⚒ Use / Attack button is released, or after one minute of continuous use. Being a melee weapon, it costs no mana or ammunition. The Flying Knife also emits a good deal of light during use, but it may be difficult to use considering its erratic movement. Like most piercing weapons, it is very effective against enemies with multiple segments. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, the bonus knockback granted by the Godly modifier is not always beneficial and makes it tricky to damage the same targets. For example, the knife will not necessarily be knocking enemies away from the player. Alternatively, modifiers that reduce knockback (the best being Ruthless) can be beneficial, reducing the distance enemies are knocked away from the cursor.


=== TNT Barrel ===
Description: The TNT Barrel is a Functional Furniture item that explodes when Enemies or Player weapons come in contact with it, inflicting 400 damage. The explosion covers ten tiles and will not destroy blocks in a radius.

=== Bast Statue ===
Description: The Bast Statue is a furniture item that grants The Bast Defense buff to players in its vicinity, increasing their defense by 5 points. The buff effect can be toggled via wire. The statue can be found in Sandstone Chests in the lower portion of the Underground Desert, or be found as a furniture in Underground Cabins, or in Oasis Crate and Mirage Crates. The buff is applied to any players standing within a rectangular area of 169×125[1] () / 100×84 () tiles centered on the Bast Statue, similar to Heart Lanterns and Campfires.


=== Arrow Signs ===
Description: Arrow Signs are furniture items used in Golfing. They are purely decorative and come in a regular and a painted variety. They are both purchased from the Golfer for 20 each. It is possible to turn the orientation of arrows with a right-click (⚷ Interact) into 8 different directions.

=== Shadow Candle ===
Description: The Shadow Candle is a furniture item that can be placed or held to nullify the enemy spawn reduction and passive NPC spawning benefits of towns, allowing enemies to spawn more frequently. It grants players the Shadow Candle debuff. When placed, the debuff is applied to any players standing within a rectangular area of 169×125[1] () / 100×84 () tiles centered on the Shadow Candle. It emits a very small amount of light.

It has a 3.33*1/30 (3.33%) chance to be dropped by Granite Elementals and Granite Golems. It can also be purchased from the Cyborg for 5 / 10, after the Martian Madness event has been defeated at least once.

Before reaching full firing speed, the Laser Machinegun will spin up for roughly two seconds. Each shot fires 2 inaccurate lasers. Like the Razorpine, the projectiles do not pierce through enemies. Its best modifier is Mythical.

=== Squirrel ===
Description: Squirrels are harmless critters that can be caught with a Bug Net and do not normally interact with the player in any other way, except in that they can be killed by both players and enemies. They have 5 health and usually serve as ambient entities in Terraria. Similar to Bunnies, they appear in the Forest biome. On PC, Console, Mobile, Old Chinese, tModLoader, and tModLoader Legacy, the Gold Squirrel has a 1 in 150 chance of spawning instead of a normal one. These gold critters sell for 10 each. Gold critters are rare creatures which are detected by the Lifeform Analyzer. Visual identification is helped by the sparkles they emit when alive in the world. Most naturally spawned Squirrels can be caught with a Bug Net, and carried in the player's inventory (or placed in storage). If a critter caught with any Bug Net is taken from inventory and "used" (placed), it is again released into the environment at the cursor and behaves as usual. On PC, Console, Mobile, Old Chinese, tModLoader, and tModLoader Legacy, Squirrels can be sold to any NPC vendor. All caught Squirrels can be crafted into Squirrel Cages to create animated display furniture. Once crafted, the critter cannot be released. The Squirrel Cage occupies a 6x3 space. The Squirrel inside may follow these patterns randomly: On PC, Console, Mobile, tModLoader, and tModLoader Legacy, Critters spawned from statues cannot be caught with the Bug Net; attempting to do so will cause the critter to disappear in a puff of smoke. If critter hunting on PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, the best way to spawn any gem bunny or squirrel is to make a cavern town (not underground, it is one layer deeper) with three NPCs having moved in. The Bestiary entry for the Squirrel: "Fast moving and erratic woodland creatures with grayish-brown fur. Got nuts? "

Ingredients: TerrariumSquirrel

=== Shadowflame Knife ===
Description: The Shadowflame Knife is a Hardmode melee weapon that auto-fires small flaming knife projectiles that consume no mana or ammunition. The projectiles ricochet twice off enemies only (not blocks), dissipating upon their third impact. They also inflict the Shadowflame debuff for between 1 and 3 seconds, which deals an additional 15 damage per second. The Shadowflame Knife has a 16.67*1/6 (16.67%) / 33.33*1/3 (33.33%) chance to drop from a Goblin Warlock during a Hardmode Goblin Army. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.


=== Luminite Bar ===
Description: Luminite Bars are a type of bar used to craft all four sets of endgame armor and tools as well as other endgame items. The only way to obtain it is to craft it from Luminite, which is dropped from the Moon Lord, at an Ancient Manipulator. Each time the Moon Lord is killed, it drops enough Luminite for 17-25 bars (21-27 in Expert/Master mode). Crafting all items (excluding ammunition) requires a total of 317 Luminite Bars (1,268 Luminite; requires defeating the Moon Lord 15–19 / 12–15 times). Crafting all items pertaining to one type of Lunar Fragment (i.e., armor, wings, pickaxe, and hamaxe) requires 68 Luminite Bars (272 Luminite) in addition to 85 of the Lunar Fragment; this requires defeating the Moon Lord only 3 / 2-3 times.

=== Cooked Marshmallow ===
Description: A Cooked Marshmallow is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff. This lasts for 10 minutes, but can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon ( ), by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu ( ), by double-tapping the buff icon ( ), or by canceling the buff from the buffs screen (). The Cooked Marshmallow is created by holding a Marshmallow on a Stick over a Campfire for 15 real-world seconds (15 in-game minutes). The Marshmallow on a Stick must be held by the player, either by attaching it to the cursor in the inventory or selecting it on the hotbar, for the entire 15 seconds over the campfire in order for it to be cooked. Selecting a different item in the hotbar or simply moving away from the campfire resets the timer. Like all other food items, it can be placed on a Plate: .

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Cooked Marshmallow
Ingredients: Marshmallow on a Stick
Crafting Station: Campfire


=== Dirt Wall ===
Description: Dirt Wall is a background wall made from Dirt Blocks. A naturally occurring variety of Dirt Walls are generated with a new world, as the background in most caves and under most overhangs above 0 depth (above the Underground layer). They will not stop enemies from spawning and are not suitable for housing. In addition, they drop nothing when destroyed with a Hammer. Non-naturally occurring Dirt Walls can be recognized by their slightly different sprite (they have tiny grey stones, where natural ones are plain dirt but have occasional large rocks). Additionally, they function properly for housing, and drop items when broken. They blend with the generated walls.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Dirt Wall4
Ingredients: Dirt Block
Crafting Station: Work Bench


=== Sniper Rifle ===
Description: The Sniper Rifle is a Hardmode, post-Plantera ranged weapon that fires a bullet with extremely high damage and velocity, though at a far slower rate of fire than most ranged weapons, and cannot auto-fire (except on the Mobile version). It also has a "zoom" ability. The Sniper Rifle has a 8.33*1/12 (8.33%) / 15.97*23/144 (15.97%) chance to be dropped by Skeleton Snipers, who most commonly spawn in Dungeon areas with Slab Walls during Hardmode after Plantera has been defeated. The Sniper Rifle's "zoom" ability is functionally identical to that of the Binoculars and the Rifle Scope and its upgrades. It allows the screen to scroll temporarily in the direction of the cursor, essentially extending the viewing range in one direction. Zoom is activated via one of the following methods: The Sniper Rifle has a base 29% / 19% critical strike chance, as opposed to the usual 4%. It is one of the few weapons lacking auto-fire on the Nintendo 3DS version. Its best modifier is Unreal.


=== Eventide ===
Description: The Eventide is a Hardmode, post-Plantera bow that auto-fires five rainbow-colored Twilight Lance projectiles if Wooden Arrows are used as ammunition. One of the lances will do double base damage. When using other ammunition, one of the five shots fired by the bow will be converted into a Twilight Lance and do double the base damage. All lances or arrows are aimed at the cursor. The lances can pierce up to four enemies. The Eventide has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by the Empress of Light. Its best modifier is Unreal.


=== Wooden Sword ===
Description: The Wooden Sword is an early-game melee weapon, and the weakest out of the seven wooden swords. It is considered a significant upgrade from the starting Copper Shortsword due to its higher damage and broadsword arc motion. This facilitates pushing enemies further away, and it is therefore recommended to craft this sword as soon as possible. All newly created characters begin with a Wooden Sword instead of a Copper Shortsword. It inflicts less damage than the Copper Shortsword, however it can strike flying enemies (unlike the Copper Shortsword). Its best modifier is Legendary.

Description: Pumpkins are a crafting material that grow on grass on the surface. They can be planted manually by the player year-round by purchasing Pumpkin Seeds from the Dryad NPC and placing them on grass on the surface. They also grow naturally randomly on grass during the Halloween and Oktoberfest seasonal events. Harvesting fully grown Pumpkins during the Halloween season will rarely yield a Magical Pumpkin Seed, which is used to summon the Squashling pet. Pumpkin Seeds each require two blocks width and two blocks height to grow Pumpkins.

=== Ghastly Glaive ===
Description: The Ghastly Glaive is a Hardmode spear which is dropped by the Ogre mini-boss during the Old One's Army event. Unlike most spears, the Ghastly Glaive wobbles when swung, causing its head to "slash" across a semi-randomized width. Upon striking an enemy, a yellow dragon-head ghost appears next to a random nearby enemy and flies in a straight line through it, damaging all enemies it passes through before vanishing after one second. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.

=== Pair of Eyeballs ===

=== Shroomite Digging Claw ===
Description: The Shroomite Digging Claw is a Hardmode, post-Plantera pickaxe and axe. It is capable of mining every type of block except Lihzahrd Bricks. It is the fastest pickaxe in the game. It deals 15 pickaxe hits per second without any modifiers, and 20 with the Legendary modifier. It can mine almost every block in the game in 1 hit, with the exception of a few blocks. Mythril Ore, Orichalcum Ore, Adamantite Ore, Titanium Ore, and Wooden Spikes take 2 hits and Chlorophyte Ore takes 3. It chops any tree in 0.27 seconds without any modifiers, and 0.2 seconds with the Light modifier. See also Mining Speed for a comparison of all mining tools in the game. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

Crafting Recipes:

Ingredients: Shroomite Bar18
Crafting Station: Mythril AnvilorOrichalcum Anvil


=== Ebonwood Hammer ===
Description: The Ebonwood Hammer is a low-tier hammer. Stat-wise, it is superior to the Copper and Tin Hammers, but not as potent as the Lead and Iron Hammers. Because the Corruption is usually not far from the spawn, an Ebonwood Hammer makes a good starting hammer. Its Crimson counterpart, the Shadewood Hammer, is identical in everything but crafting recipe. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

=== Purple Mucus ===

=== Terragrim ===
Description: The Terragrim is a rare pre-Hardmode melee weapon that appears to be a sword, but does not present an actual blade when used. Instead of an overhead broadsword swing or a shortsword stab, the Terragrim autoswings and appears as a series of blurred slashes aimed in the direction of the cursor. Anything within this area takes constant damage at a rate far exceeding the weapon's stated use time. This damaging area has a rather wide spread, even attacking behind the player for a very short distance. It is obtainable from the unique background object found in an Enchanted Sword Shrine or very rarely in the Caverns layer. When the object is destroyed, it has a 2*1/50 (2%) chance to drop a Terragrim rather than an Enchanted Sword. The Terragrim's unique means of attack is unaffected by any size and speed modifiers. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.


=== High Test Fishing Line ===
Description: The High Test Fishing Line is an accessory with a 2.5*1/40 (2.5%)[1] chance of being awarded by the Angler for completing a quest. While equipped, it prevents fishing line from breaking while fishing. Without the High Test Fishing Line equipped, there is a 1 in 7 chance that the line will break on any reel-in that was supposed to yield a catch. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, the Angler will not give the player a High Test Fishing Line as a reward if they already have one in their inventory or in any of their Portable Storages. However, if the player has a High Test Fishing Line, Angler Earring, and Tackle Box (or they have the accessory crafted from them, the Angler Tackle Bag) in their inventories, he will be able to give the player duplicate High Test Fishing Lines.[1]

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Angler Earring
Ingredients: High Test Fishing Line
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation
----------------------------------------
Result: Angler Tackle Bag
Ingredients: High Test Fishing LineTackle BoxAngler Earring
Crafting Station: Tinkerer's Workshop


=== Solar Dye ===
Description: Solar Dye is a Hardmode, endgame dye crafted from Solar Fragments dropped by the Solar Pillar from the Lunar Events. The dye gives a golden, metallic hue and a slight pulsating effect to anything used with it, similar to the Reflective Dyes obtainable from the Dye Trader's Strange Plants quest. Unlike the Metallic dyes, however, items dyed with Solar Dye do not appear to dynamically reflect light, and have the same appearance regardless of the player's proximity to light sources. Also unlike the metallic dyes, dyed items periodically glow (without casting light).

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Solar Dye
Ingredients: Bottled WaterSolar Fragment10
Crafting Station: Dye Vat


=== Bottomless Water Bucket ===
Description: The Bottomless Water Bucket is an item that functions similarly to the standard Water Bucket, the only differences being that it never needs refilling (and cannot be filled), it can be used an infinite number of times, has a slightly extended range, and can place water slightly faster than a standard bucket (especially when moving the cursor around while filling). It is one of the possible rewards from the Angler upon completing one of his fishing quests, with a 1.43*1/70 (1.43%) chance per quest after the 10th quest. On PC, Console, Mobile, and tModLoader, it is available in pre-hardmode, as a guaranteed drop at 25 quests. On tModLoader Legacy, it is only available in hardmode.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Bottomless Water Bucket(After Moon Lord is defeated)
Ingredients: Bottomless Shimmer Bucket
Crafting Station: Shimmer Transmutation


=== Ammo Reservation Potion ===
Description: The Ammo Reservation Potion is a buff potion which grants the Ammo Reservation buff when consumed. The buff reduces the chance of consuming any ammunition by 20%. This lasts for 8 minutes, but can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon ( ), by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu ( ), by double-tapping the buff icon ( ), or by canceling the buff from the buffs screen ().

=== 1.1 ===
Description: 1.1 "Terraria 1.1" Release date December 1, 2011 [1] Version chronology ← Previous Next → 1.0.6.1 1.1.1 Version history • All patches The 1.1 patch was the largest update to date in terms of new content before the 1.2 update. It introduced Hardmode, the Wall of Flesh, and the mechanical bosses. (Be aware though, using any other lighting modes than retro will cut off 17 blocks on each side of the map.)


=== Plantera Seedling ===
Description: The Plantera Seedling is a Master Mode-exclusive pet dropped by Plantera with a 1/40 (2.5%) chance. Upon use, it summons a Plantera Seedling pet.


=== Mollusk Whistle ===
Description: The Mollusk Whistle is a mount-summoning item that summons a rideable Flamingo mount. It can be purchased from the Zoologist for 20 after 25% of the Bestiary have been unlocked (135 entries). The mount allows players to float in water, similar to using an Inner Tube, and dive by holding ▼ Down. The mount bobs to the surface when the ▼ Down key is released, and if deep enough, the player will launch out of the water into the air. This feature no longer functions while wearing Neptune's Shell or any effect that turns the player into a Merfolk. The flamingo will run unhindered underwater while the player has this buff.


=== Tally Counter ===
Description: The Tally Counter is a post-Skeletron informational accessory which displays how many enemies of a type have been killed. The Tally Counter will first display "Kill count unavailable" underneath the map/health area and after an enemy has been attacked, the text will display how many times that enemy has ever been killed by all players combined in that world. The kill count will only display the last enemy struck by the player or their minions. It will count deaths from world creation rather than from when it was equipped. It has a 1*1/100 (1%) chance of being dropped from Angry Bones, Cursed Skulls, and Dark Casters, all of which are found in the Dungeon. The Tally Counter is one of the three parts necessary to make the R.E.K. 3000, with the others being the Lifeform Analyzer and the Radar, and as such is a required ingredient in making the Cell Phone.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: R.E.K. 3000
Ingredients: Tally CounterLifeform AnalyzerRadar
Crafting Station: Tinkerer's Workshop


=== Bubble Wand ===
Description: The Bubble Wand is an auto-swing novelty item that produces rainbow-colored bubbles. The bubbles are purely visual, have no functional effect, and can be produced infinitely at no cost. The Bubble Wand is purchased from the Party Girl for 5. Each bubble is of a random size, and a random one of four possible colors: Pink, purple, green, or blue. With no obstacles in the way, bubbles last for random durations. They will pop on contact with characters or foreground blocks.


=== Shell Pile ===
Description: Shell Piles are a decorative block found naturally in the Ocean biome in large clumps. They are affected by gravity and will fall if supporting blocks are removed, dealing damage to any player or enemy they land on. They can also be found in Ocean Crates or in Seaside Crates.

=== Terra Blade ===
Description: The Terra Blade is a post-Plantera Hardmode projectile sword. When used, it fires a green wave projectile / a green sword projectile , which costs neither mana nor ammunition, deals 50% / 25% more damage than the sword, and can pierce through two enemies, dissipating after hitting a third enemy or a wall. The projectile is affected by Attack speed, it fires once every time the Terra Blade is swung. The projectile can travel up to 500 feet (250 tiles). The projectile gradually decelerates, and eventually comes to a full stop where it fades away. Its best modifier is Legendary. PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version: Old-gen console version, Windows Phone version, Old Chinese version, Nintendo 3DS version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version:

Armor dyed by it can be seen in the dark, but does not provide light. Equipping Acid Dye, Red Acid Dye or Blue Acid Dye on the Shadow Orb can make parts of it or the whole orb invisible.

=== Shadowbeam Staff ===
Description: The Shadowbeam Staff is a Hardmode, post-Plantera magic weapon that is similar to the Necromancer's standard attack, creating a purple beam that travels instantaneously to its maximum distance (approximately 108 tiles), bounces off blocks, is unaffected by gravity, and emits a moderate amount of light for its entire length. It has a 5*1/20 (5%) / 7.38*59/800 (7.38%) chance to drop from Necromancers in the Hardmode Dungeon. The Shadowbeam Staff's projectile can travel far and pierce an unlimited number of enemies, but for each enemy struck, the beam loses 10% / 20% of its damage. Each enemy will only take damage once, regardless of how many times the beam bounces to hit them again. Its best modifier is Mythical.


=== Green Horseshoe Balloon ===
Description: The Green Horseshoe Balloon is an accessory that grants immunity to fall damage, increases jump height by 33%, jump speed by 30%, and grants a double jump. The height of the first jump is increased from 6 blocks to 10.5 blocks (~75% increase), while the double jump's height is increased from 10.5 blocks to 18.5 blocks, reaching a total of 29 blocks with both jumps. It also has the fart sound of the previous fart double jumps. Jump height is oddly reduced when underwater, to 18 blocks (7 blocks + ~11 blocks from Fart jump).

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Green Horseshoe Balloon
Ingredients: Fart in a BalloonLucky Horseshoe
Crafting Station: Tinkerer's Workshop


=== Picksaw ===
Description: The Picksaw is a Hardmode pickaxe and axe that has a 25*1/4 (25%) or 33.33*1/3 (33.33%) / 12.5*1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by the Golem boss. It can mine all blocks in the game. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool.


=== Cloud in a Balloon ===
Description: The Cloud in a Balloon is an accessory that combines the functionality of the Cloud in a Bottle and the Shiny Red Balloon. It boosts jump height by 33%, and jump speed by 30%, increasing the player's first jump's height to 10.5 blocks (~75% increase), and provides a double jump that hits 9 blocks, for a total height of 19.5 blocks. Jump height is reduced when underwater, reducing your total underwater height from 15 blocks (8 + 7 from Cloud jump) to 13 blocks (7 + 6 from Cloud jump).

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Cloud in a Balloon
Ingredients: Cloud in a BottleShiny Red Balloon
Crafting Station: Tinkerer's Workshop


=== Pulse Bow ===
Description: The Pulse Bow is a unique Hardmode bow that auto-fires a high-velocity glowing light blue bolt, which is unaffected by gravity, will pierce enemies, can ricochet, and flies for 3.5 seconds (about 480 tiles) before dissipating. It is purchased from the Traveling Merchant after all 3 Mechanical Bosses have been defeated for 45gold. The projectile can pierce or ricochet five times in total, dissipating upon the sixth hit. Each ricochet causes the bolt to pierce one less enemy and vice versa. Like other bows and repeaters, it can use any arrow type as ammunition. However, the Pulse Bow converts all arrows to its special bolt. Normal effects of various arrow types are canceled, except for their damage statistic. The Pulse Bow has a base 11% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%. The Traveling Merchant will use it for self-defense once a world is in Hardmode. Its best modifier is Unreal.


=== Scaly Truffle ===
Description: The Scaly Truffle is a Hardmode mount-summoning item. When used, it summons a Pigron Mount that allows the player to fly for a limited time, and run faster on land. It is obtained by fishing in the cavern layer of an Ice biome overlapping a Hallow, Corruption, or Crimson biome in Hardmode.


=== White Tuxedo set ===
Description: The White Tuxedo set is a vanity set which consists of the White Tuxedo Shirt and the White Tuxedo Pants. It is purchased from the Clothier for 50 (set), on the night of a Full Moon. The set exists on Old-gen console, Windows Phone, and 3DS, but is unobtainable on these versions.


=== Turtle Shell ===
Description: The Turtle Shell is a Hardmode crafting material that has a 5.88*1/17 (5.88%) chance of being dropped by the Giant Tortoises in the Hardmode Jungle and Underground Jungle. Turtle Shells are used solely to craft Turtle armor, which can in turn be used to craft Beetle armor. Crafting all pieces of Turtle armor requires a total of 3 Turtle Shells, but, since Beetle Armor has two chest variants, you would need 4 Turtle Shells to craft the armor with both chest pieces. On average, you will need to kill 105 Giant Tortoises for a 95% chance to get 3 Turtle Shells (140 for 99%). If you want to get 4 Turtle Shells instead, this number is raised to 130 for 95% chance (and 168 for 99%).

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Turtle Helmet
Ingredients: Chlorophyte Bar12Turtle Shell
Crafting Station: Mythril AnvilorOrichalcum Anvil


=== Sanguine Staff ===
Description: The Sanguine Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon that has a 50*1/2 (50%) / 100*1/1 (100%)chance of being dropped by the Dreadnautilus during a Blood Moon. It summons a Sanguine Bat minion that remains by the player's side until an enemy is in sight, and attacks by flying in an elliptical loop between the player and enemy. They immediately return to the player's side once their target dies. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Sanguine Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.


=== Marble Wall ===
Description: Marble Walls are background walls that generate naturally as background in Marble Caves. Like other natural walls they normally drop nothing when destroyed with a hammer, promote enemy spawns, and are invalid for housing. However, Marble Walls generated as part of Underground Cabins can be picked up, prevent enemy spawns, and used for housing (if the Cabin is repaired). Usable Marble Walls can also be crafted from Marble Blocks.

Ingredients: Marble Block

=== Jungle Wall ===
Description: Jungle Wall is a wall type found commonly in the Underground Jungle. It can be destroyed by the player via a Hammer, but will not drop as collectible items. Jungle Walls are purchased from the Dryad for 10 each, during hardmode. Naturally-generated Jungle Walls will not fulfill a House's wall requirement, nor will they prevent enemy spawns; however, player-placed Jungle Walls purchased from the Dryad will do both.


=== Gravity Globe ===
Description: The Gravity Globe is an Expert Mode Accessory found in the Moon Lord's Treasure Bag. When worn, it allows the holder to flip gravity, so that the player falls up instead of down, and toggle gravity back to normal afterward. Once equipped, pressing the ▲ Up key toggles the gravity direction. This only affects the player with the item equipped.


=== Cursed Flames ===
Description: The Cursed Flames is a Hardmode magic weapon that auto-fires ricocheting green fireballs that move quite similarly to those from the Flower of Fire or Flower of Frost, are affected by gravity, and set enemies on fire with the Cursed Inferno debuff. Cursed Flames auto-fires at a rate of 4 / 3 attacks per second. Its fireballs can ricochet four times, dissipating on their fifth impact, and pierce enemies two times, dissipating on the second enemy hit. They are also highly luminous, and can travel through water without slowing, making them useful for cave exploration. The Cursed Flames is the Corruption counterpart to the Crimson's Golden Shower, and the Hallow's Crystal Storm. Crafting the Cursed Flames requires ingredients found only in worlds containing Corruption, however, you can get Corrupt Seeds on Crimson worlds from the Dryad, allowing the ability to build an artificial Corruption biome and farm the resources. Its best modifier is Mythical.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: only:Cursed Flames
Ingredients: Spell TomeCursed Flame30Soul of Night15
Crafting Station: Bookcase


=== Grasshopper ===
Description: The Grasshopper is a type of critter that can be found when destroying grass. It can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into a Grasshopper Cage to be used as decorative furniture. Once crafted, the caged Grasshopper cannot be released again, and when placed down it moves around inside the cage as it would do outside. Grasshoppers can also be used as bait for fishing. 5 Grasshoppers can be obtained when the Grasshopper Statue is thrown into Shimmer. The Bestiary entry for the Grasshopper: "It leaps tall blades of grass in a single bound. Fish are fairly attracted to these."

When equipped in an accessory slot or simply held in the inventory, a clock will appear in the upper-right corner of the playing screen, revealing the in-game time accurate to the last half an hour. Half an hour of Terraria game time is equivalent to half a minute of real-world time.

=== Sickle ===
Description: The Sickle is a tool that produces Hay blocks when used to cut tall grass. The collected Hay can be used for building purposes and crafted into Target Dummies and Hay Walls. Due to its comparably potent damage-dealing capabilities (only slightly inferior to the Tin Broadsword) and its ability to autoswing, it can also be used as a melee weapon in the very early game. The Sickle is purchased from the Merchant for 60. On the Old-gen console version, Windows Phone version, and Nintendo 3DS version, it is only available during the Halloween season. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.


=== Monk's Belt ===
Description: The Monk's Belt is a Hardmode accessory that increases the maximum number of sentries by one and increases summon damage by 10%. It is dropped by the Ogre during the Old One's Army event with a 8.33% / 12.5% (T2) or 4.17% (T3) chance. The Monk's Belt is functionally identical to the Huntress's Buckler.


=== Shadow Chest ===
Description: The Shadow Chest is a storage item which is found only in The Underworld, generally on top of or within Ruined Houses, and contains rare items. All Shadow Chests are initially locked, requiring a Shadow Key to open. The key is not consumed when used. Each Shadow Chest contains one high-tier item of 03* rarity, along with other standard Underground loot. Like all other naturally-occurring Chests, Shadow Chests can be freed with a pickaxe or drill after being emptied, and picked up by the player for placement and use elsewhere. Each Shadow Chest will always contain one primary item, and can potentially contain multiple secondary items, or none at all. In addition, it can contain one or more common items.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Trapped Shadow Chest
Ingredients: Shadow ChestWire10
Crafting Station: Heavy Work Bench

Ocram can only be summoned in a Hardmode world at night. The Suspicious Looking Skull requires, in total, 20 Souls of Light, 6 Lenses, 15 Iron/Lead Bars, 30 Bones, 8 Souls of Night, and 10 Adamantite/Titanium Bars.

On Old Chinese and tModLoader Legacy versions, it displays measurement lines for counting blocks while building, whereas on Old-gen console, Windows Phone, and 3DS versions, it displays a grid framework similar to that of the Mechanical Ruler. On the PC, Console, Mobile, and tModLoader versions, the Ruler is an autoswinging shortsword and can be purchased for 10. On these versions, the measurement lines can always be toggled via the "Ruler On"/"Ruler Off" button in the upper left of the inventory. Its best modifier is Legendary.

=== Slimy Saddle ===
Description: The Slimy Saddle is a mount-summoning item. When used, it summons a friendly Slime Mount. The Slime offers increased jump height (21 tiles) and movement speed (20 mph), decreases fall damage by half, and enables floating on water surfaces and continuous auto-jump by holding the ↷ Jump key. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, Old Chinese version, tModLoader version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, landing on enemies while riding this mount will deal 40 summon damage (excluding defense) to them in addition to pushing the player back up again. For this damage, the Slime Mount is considered a minion and benefits from effects that boost the damage of summons. The Slimy Saddle has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by King Slime in normal mode, and a 50*1/2 (50%) chance of being found in a King Slime Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

=== Glowstick ===
Description: The Glowstick is a light source that can be held or be tossed a fair distance, and works underwater, but cannot be placed on a wall or floor like the Torch can (though the Sticky Glowstick will stick to surfaces they are thrown against). Glowsticks will emit light for a lengthy period of time after being thrown, and have a 33.33*1/3 (33.33%) chance to be recoverable after 5 minutes. Glowsticks can be purchased from the Merchant for 10 each during the Night or from the Skeleton Merchant for 10 during the day, if there was no full Moon. Glowsticks are also dropped by all Jellyfish, or Flying Fish and Raincoat Zombies while it's Raining, and can be found commonly in Pots and Chests.

=== Toy Sled ===
Description: The Toy Sled is a pet summoning item that summons a baby snowman pet when used. It has a 1/20 (5%) chance of being dropped by Ice Mimics found in the Snow Biome. When far enough away, the Baby Snowman will ride a toy sled to catch up to the player.


=== Builder Potion ===

This lasts for 45 / 15 minutes, but can be canceled at any time by right-clicking the icon ( ), by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu ( ), or by double-tapping the buff icon ( ).

=== Cat Ears ===

=== Reflective Copper Dye ===
Description: Reflective Copper Dye is a type of dye that is randomly given to you when you give a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader NPC. When equipped, it will give the selected accessory/armor a copper-plated, "shiny" effect, reflecting the surrounding light around the player. The reflection is more pronounced the closer the player is to a light source. The dye will prioritize light from the sun when the player is outside. From some perspectives, the player may look 3D when this dye is equipped all over. As with other reflective dyes, this dye is not animated when standing still, but the shading on a dyed piece of equipment will change according to the surrounding light, giving it the appearance of light reflecting off of a shining metallic object.


=== Plum ===
Description: The Plum is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff. This lasts for 5 minutes, but can be canceled at any time by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu () or by double-tapping the buff icon (). It has a 3.11% chance to drop from shaken Boreal Trees in the Snow biome. Like all other food items, it can be placed on a Plate: .

=== Arctic Diving Gear ===
Description: The Arctic Diving Gear is an accessory which is crafted by combining the Jellyfish Diving Gear and Ice Skates at a Tinkerer's Workshop. It combines the swimming and breathing effects of the Diving Gear with the underwater lighting effect of the Jellyfish Necklace (in the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, it gives a very faint glow out of water and honey and its brightness is significantly increased when submerged), as well as the enhanced mobility on ice effect of the Ice Skates. In addition to combining these effects into a single accessory, it has the unique ability of preventing the Chilled debuff when touching water in Snow or Ice biomes in Expert Mode.

=== Obsidian Lock Box ===
Description: The Obsidian Lock Box is a grab bag-type item which is obtained from Obsidian and Hellstone Crates with a 100% chance. It always contains one rare item normally found in locked Shadow Chests in the Underworld. It requires a Shadow Key to be in the player's inventory to open the box, which can be found in locked Gold Chests or Golden Lock Boxes in the Dungeon.


=== Mythril Waraxe ===
Description: The Mythril Waraxe is a Hardmode axe that is obtainable after crafting a Mythril Anvil or an Orichalcum Anvil, and is the axe alternative to the Mythril Chainsaw. Along with its slightly stronger counterpart, the Orichalcum Waraxe, it is stronger than the Cobalt or Palladium Waraxe but weaker than the Adamantite or Titanium Waraxe which can be obtained later. Like all other axes and chainsaws, it is solely used to cut down trees, cacti and Giant Glowing Mushrooms. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Mythril Waraxe
Ingredients: Mythril Bar10
Crafting Station: Mythril AnvilorOrichalcum Anvil


=== Gelatinous Pillion ===
Description: The Gelatinous Pillion is a Hardmode mount-summoning item. When used, it summons a friendly Winged Slime Mount. Similar to the pre-Hardmode Slime Mount, the Winged Slime offers increased jump height, provides boosted movement speed, negates fall damage, and allows continuous auto-jump by holding the ↷ Jump key. It also shares the Slime Mount's abilities to deal damage 40 summon damage to enemies when jumping on them from above, and floating when entering liquids. The Winged Slime Mount grants 2.66 seconds of flight time, similar to low-tier wings, allowing the player to fly up to a height of 73 tiles, as well as gliding while holding the ↷ Jump key after flight time has been exhausted. It can also hover by holding ▼ Down, similar to the Hoverboard. The Gelatinous Pillion has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Queen Slime in Classic Mode, or a 50*1/2 (50%) chance of being found in Queen Slime's Treasure Bag.


=== Terrarian ===
Description: The Terrarian is a Hardmode, post-Moon Lord yoyo with a reach of 25 tiles and an infinite spin time, allowing it to stay in the air indefinitely. Similarly to the Flairon, it fires short-lived projectiles at a rapid rate that home in on nearby enemies and bounce off of walls while being used. The Terrarian has a 22.22*2/9 (22.22%) chance to drop from the Moon Lord, and is currently the most powerful yoyo in the game. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, the Terrarian's best modifier is Legendary. Although yoyos cannot normally obtain the Legendary modifier, the Terrarian is an exception and receives a unique set of boosts from the Legendary modifier; +17% damage, +8% critical strike chance, and +17% knockback. On the Old Chinese version and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, its best modifier is Legendary.


=== Stardrop ===
Description: The Stardrop is a pet-summoning item that can be summoned by the Dryad by giving her a Joja Cola and allowing her to purify it. It is used to summon the Junimo pet. It will follow the player at any speed and fly by spinning the leaf on it's head once the player is too far away.


=== Martian Dye ===
Description: Martian Dye is a Hardmode, post-Golem dye that is sometimes acquired from the Dye Trader after completing a Strange Plant quest. It is only obtainable after completing a Martian Madness event. When equipped, it gives the player an aquamarine tone.


=== Gold Mouse ===
Description: The Gold Mouse is a Critter. It is a rare, golden recolor of an ordinary Mouse, with a 0.25*1/400 (0.25%) / 0.67*1/150 (0.67%) chance of spawning in place of the ordinary version. As with all other gold critters, it can be caught with a Bug Net and sold for 10. It might be hard to get, since Underground environment is more hostile than other places (like the Surface, where most of the other critters spawn), especially on Hardmode. It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

Ingredients: TerrariumGold Mouse

Result: Golden Delight

Crafting Station: Cooking PotorCauldron


=== Light Disc ===
Description: The Light Disc is a Hardmode boomerang-type weapon that deals melee damage. The Light Disc requires 20 Hallowed Bars, 15 Soul of Light, and 25 Soul of Might. Light Discs have the rare ability to throw up to 6 out at a time in rapid succession. They are quicker than other boomerangs, and can ricochet any number of times. After approximately two seconds, the disc will return to the thrower. Light Disc physics are similar to those of the Thorn Chakram, though Light Discs have nearly twice the range and do not "wobble" as they travel. They also emit a small amount of light, comparable to the glow of Demonite, Crimtane, or Crystal Shards. Light Discs cannot have modifiers through any usual in-game means, due to their stackable nature. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: only:Light Disc
Ingredients: Hallowed Bar4Soul of Light3Soul of Might5
Crafting Station: Mythril AnvilorOrichalcum Anvil

=== Cobalt Ore ===
Description: Cobalt Ore is the lowest tier of Hardmode Ore, and can spawn on the first breaking of an Altar. More will spawn on the 4th, 7th, 10th, etc destroyed Altars, albeit in decreasing amounts. Mining Cobalt Ore requires at least a Molten Pickaxe. It is immune to all types of explosions. Palladium Ore may generate in place of Cobalt Ore. It is slightly more valuable, and the tools and weapons it crafts have slightly better stats.

=== Falcon Blade ===
Description: The Falcon Blade is a pre-Hardmode broadsword that has a 6.25*1/16 (6.25%) chance to be found in an Iron or Mythril Crate. It has a very short range, yet high attack speed and decent knockback, which makes it useful until late pre-Hardmode. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, Old Chinese version, tModLoader version, and tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, the Falcon Blade is capable of autoswing. Its best modifier is Legendary.


=== Giant Bow ===
Description: The Giant Bow is a festive Vanity item that has a 5*1/20 (5%) chance to drop during Christmas by Present Slimes, which visually have a large bow on. The Bow itself is red, but it can drop from any of the four colors of Present Slime. When worn in the helmet slot, a bow appears on top of the player's head.


=== Piece of Moon Squid ===
Description: The Piece of Moon Squid is a pet item that has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance to drop from the Moon Lord in Master Mode. It summons a pet Moonling that resembles the Moon Lord's head.


=== Titanium Pickaxe ===
Description: The Titanium Pickaxe is a Hardmode pickaxe and the pickaxe alternative to the Titanium Drill, having a slower mining speed but longer range and benefiting from mining speed bonuses. Its alternate ore counterpart, the Adamantite Pickaxe, is slightly weaker than the Titanium Pickaxe. It can mine all blocks except Chlorophyte Ore and Lihzahrd Bricks. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool.

=== Rainbow Rod ===
Description: The Rainbow Rod is a Hardmode magic weapon that launches a controllable projectile, just like the Flamelash or Magic Missile, and can be considered an upgraded version of them. The projectile it fires is a white-sparkling missile with a rainbow trail, and emits a moderate amount of light that rotates through the entire color spectrum / a light orb shifting through rainbow colors with a rainbow trail. It can be controlled by holding ⚒ Use / Attack and moving the cursor. If ⚒ Use / Attack is released mid-drag, the missile will be flung in that direction. If the cursor is stationary on release, it continues along the angle formed from the player. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, if any enemies are nearby, the missile will home in on them. The missile will not disappear when touching a block if it is being manually controlled. It can move through liquids (unlike the Flamelash), and can pierce twice before exploding and dealing damage in a small area. Its best modifier is Mythical.

=== Phase Dye ===
Description: Phase Dye is a Hardmode dye sometimes acquired from the Dye Trader after completing a Strange Plant quest. It seems to greatly darken the colors of the object it is attached to as well as giving a strange purple aura. When the user is damaged, the dye flashes very quickly.


=== Mirage Crate ===
Description: The Mirage Crate is a Hardmode crate that can only be fished in the Desert biome. Mirage Crates contain items found in standard crates, and always contain one item normally found in a Sandstone Chest in the Underground Desert. It has a texture resembling that of the Forbidden armor. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Oasis Crate. Note: Only one type of ore and one type of bar can drop, not both a pre-Hardmode type of ore and a Hardmode type of ore, or both a pre-Hardmode type of bar and a Hardmode type of bar. The table above implies otherwise with the respective groups being in separate rows, but that is for readability purposes. The chance that a type of ore is dropped is 14.29*1/7 (14.29%), and the chance that a type of bar is dropped is 25*1/4 (25%).

Ingredients: Mirage Crate

=== 1.2.4.1 ===
Description: 1.2.4.1 "Hotfixes" Release date May 15, 2014 [1] Version chronology ← Previous Next → 1.2.4 1.3.0.1 Version history • All patches The 1.2.4.1 patch added some missing recipes and fixed a number of bugs, and is the last update of 1.2.


=== Explosives ===
Description: Explosives are a placeable, consumable mechanism that can be triggered using wiring. Triggering them causes a large explosion that covers a radius of ten tiles (up to 314 blocks total), destroying most placed blocks and items (except for explosion-proof items), and inflicting around 500 damage to entities – meaning they can kill or severely damage even players with late-game gear. Natural Explosive traps wired to Pressure Plates or Detonators can be found rarely underground, usually next to a vein of ores. Explosives can also be crafted.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Explosives
Ingredients: Dynamite3Wire
Crafting Station: By Hand


=== Butcher's Chainsaw ===
Description: The Butcher's Chainsaw is a Hardmode, post-Plantera chainsaw that has a 2.5% / 3.75% (1/40 / 3/80) chance to drop from Butchers during a Solar Eclipse. Upon striking an enemy or critter, it will emit sparks akin to the projectiles produced by the Wand of Sparking, dealing damage to nearby enemies/extra segments as well. These sparks deal melee damage / magic damage, meaning that any melee / magic buffs, accessories, or armor will boost them. They also have a chance to inflict the Hellfire debuff. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. The Demonic modifier lacks the 15% knockback gain.


=== Anti-Portal Block ===
Description: The Anti-Portal Block is a Hardmode block that prevents portals made from the Portal Gun to form. This can be useful for map makers who want to make some places inaccessible by portals. They are purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 1 each.


=== Kaleidoscope ===
Description: The Kaleidoscope is a post-Plantera whip that has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by the Empress of Light boss. Like other whips, it causes minions to focus on the last-struck enemy and increases their damage against the target. Its best modifier is Legendary.


=== Cobalt Drill ===
Description: The Cobalt Drill is a Hardmode drill, and is the drill alternative to the Cobalt Pickaxe. Appearances and sounds aside, the two tools are nearly functionally identical. The drill, however is half a second faster. But, unlike pickaxes, most drills cannot be reforged with size, speed, or knockback modifiers. It can mine any block except Adamantite Ore, Titanium Ore, Chlorophyte Ore, and Lihzahrd Bricks. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it, and furthermore cannot get modifiers that affect its speed, either.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Cobalt Drill
Ingredients: Cobalt Bar15
Crafting Station: Iron AnvilorLead Anvil

=== Thorn Chakram ===
Description: The Thorn Chakram is a Pre-Hardmode boomerang that returns to its user after reaching its maximum distance or hitting an enemy. It differs from most other boomerangs in that it does not necessarily return immediately when impacting an object, but instead can ricochet off solid surfaces before returning. The Thorn Chakram has a 50*1/2 (50%) chance to inflict the Poisoned debuff. It will not fly out through ceilings or floors; but when returning to you, it will fly back through them. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.

=== Brand of the Inferno ===
Description: The Brand of the Inferno is a Hardmode sword dropped by the Ogre mini-boss during the Old One's Army event. It has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance of inflicting the On Fire! debuff for 5 seconds. With any equipped shield (including the Squire's Shield, but not Huntress's Buckler) and holding this sword, pressing the ⚷ Interact button will cause the character to brace for the next attack (like Sergeant United Shield). When timed correctly, just before taking a hit, the enemy's attack will be parried, dealing some damage to the attacker and granting the Striking Moment buff for the next 5 seconds. This allows the next melee attack to deal 5 times the damage. Alternatively, if the shield is held in place, 20 defense is temporarily gained; this lasts until the shield is once again lowered. Its best modifier is Legendary.


=== Mushroom Spear ===
Description: The Mushroom Spear is a Hardmode spear that can be purchased from the Truffle for 70 after at least one of the Mechanical bosses have been defeated. When used, it will extend the reach of the spear by summoning seven spinning mushrooms that hang in midair. It deals the third highest amount of damage out of all the spears, beaten only by the Obsidian Swordfish and the North Pole. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.


=== Bunny ===
Description: Bunnies are harmless critters that can be caught with a Bug Net and do not normally interact with the player in any other way, except in that they can be killed by both players and enemies. They have 5 health and usually serve as ambient entities in Terraria. Bunnies usually spawn only in the middle-third of the above-ground world, and only on ordinary Grass, though they can also spawn near NPCs in other locations. Bunnies are less likely to spawn in Hardmode and can be spawned by using a Bunny Statue attached to a Lever, a Pressure Plate or a Switch. During a Blood Moon, or when hit with Vile Powder or Vicious Powder, Bunnies will turn into Corrupt Bunnies or Vicious Bunnies, which have much more health and are aggressive. During the Halloween seasonal event, Bunnies spawn wearing Green Slime costumes, during Christmas, Bunnies will spawn wearing Santa costumes, and during a Party, Bunnies can spawn with Party Hats. On PC, Console, Mobile, Old Chinese, tModLoader, and tModLoader Legacy, the Gold Bunny has a 1 in 150 chance of spawning instead of a normal one. These gold critters sell for 10 each. Gold critters are rare creatures which are detected by the Lifeform Analyzer. Visual identification is helped by the sparkles they emit when alive in the world. Most naturally spawned Bunnies can be caught with a Bug Net, and carried in the player's inventory (or placed in storage). If a critter caught with any Bug Net is taken from inventory and "used" (placed), it is again released into the environment at the cursor and behaves as usual. On PC, Console, Mobile, Old Chinese, tModLoader, and tModLoader Legacy, Bunnies can be sold to any NPC vendor. All caught Bunnies can be crafted into Bunny Cages to create animated display furniture. Once crafted, the critter cannot be released. A captured Bunny can also be used to craft an Explosive Bunny to be fired from the Bunny Cannon. On PC, Console, Mobile, tModLoader, and tModLoader Legacy, Critters spawned from statues cannot be caught with the Bug Net; attempting to do so will cause the critter to disappear in a puff of smoke. Gem Bunnies spawn near towns in the Cavern layer.

Crafting Recipes:
----------------------------------------
Result: Bunny Cage
Ingredients: TerrariumBunny
Crafting Station: By Hand

Result: Bunny Stew
Ingredients: Bunny
Crafting Station: Cooking PotorCauldron
----------------------------------------
Result: only:Bunny Statue
Ingredients: Stone Block50Bunny5
Crafting Station: Heavy Work Bench
----------------------------------------
Result: only:Bunny Statue
Ingredients: Stone Block50Bunny5
Crafting Station: Heavy Work Bench and Ecto Mist


=== Houndius Shootius ===
Description: The Houndius Shootius is a pre-Hardmode sentry summon weapon. It can summon the Houndius Shootius sentry, which lasts for 10 minutes / 2 minutes , remains stationary, and does not count against the player's minion capacity. It has a 25*1/4 (25%) chance to be dropped by the Deerclops. When used, the sentry will attempt to summon at the cursor, however, if used while the cursor is midair, the sentry will spawn on the closest blocks directly downwards of the cursor. The Houndius Shootius shoots projectiles at enemies from a floating eyeball. The eyeball will point towards the player unless an enemy is close enough to attack, in which case it will point towards the enemy. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Houndius Shootius has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

=== Bunny Cannon ===
Description: The Bunny Cannon is a weapon purchased from the Pirate for 50, when the Party Girl is present, and one Hardmode boss has been defeated. It works like a Cannon, albeit firing explosive bunnies instead of cannonballs. Similar to the Cannon, the Bunny Cannon can also be triggered by wire. Depending on where the wire is connected, it will either shoot an explosive bunny or rotate toward the side the wire is on. Note that the explosive bunny fired in this manner is purely aesthetic and will do no damage to NPCs or players.


=== Ocram's Razor ===
Description: Ocram's Razor is a secret boss summon item that can only be obtained and used in the secret ''Everything'' seed. When used, it summons Mechdusa, an amalgamation of the 3 mechanical bosses who must be defeated to obtain the Waffle's Iron and progress the game. It cannot be crafted outside of the ''Everything'' seed and using it outside of the seed will do nothing. On any world that wasn't generated with the Everything seed, its description says "It has no effect in this world".

=== Pirate Staff ===
Description: The Pirate Staff is a Hardmode, pre-mechanical boss summon weapon. It spawns a pirate minion that attacks enemies by slashing them with a sword. Like other minions, the summoned Pirate is invincible and follows the player for an unlimited amount of time, unless the player dies, summons a replacement minion, cancels the buff, or leaves the world. The Pirate Staff is dropped with a 0.05*1/2000 (0.05%) chance by pirates, with a 1*1/100 (1%) chance by the Flying Dutchman or in a loot_box (every type of it) Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Pirate Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

=== Luminite Brick ===

=== Red's Throw ===
Description: Red's Throw is a Expert Mode-exclusive yoyo. It is obtainable from any Hardmode boss's Treasure Bag (except for Queen Slime) as part of Red's set. Like certain other yoyos, Red's Throw can be held in the air indefinitely. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.


=== Geyser ===
Description: Geysers are traps that spew a vertical stream of fire when triggered via wire or when stepped on by a player. They are found naturally-placed in random areas that are deep enough to generate lava, including the Underworld and deeper Cavern areas. On the PC version, Console version, Mobile version, and tModLoader version, they will activate when a player touches them, and will generate without Pressure Plates or wires. However, they can still be triggered by wires. On the tModLoader 1.3-Legacy version, they can only be triggered by wires, and will generate with Pressure Plates wired to them. They consume no ammunition, and their output is limited only by a cooldown period of 3.33 (3 1/3) seconds. Geyser streams extend approximately 20 tiles up or down, depending on placement. Geysers can be placed on the top or bottom of blocks, facing upward or downward respectively, but not sideways.


=== Golem Fist ===
Description: The Golem Fist is a Hardmode, post-Golem flail-type weapon that has a 14.29*1/7 (14.29%) / 12.5*1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by the Golem. It fires a large fist attached to a chain that retracts on impact, similar to the one Golem uses. It fires forward at a rapid rate, similar to the KO Cannon and Harpoon. Firing at closer targets causes its fire rate to increase. The Golem Fist is one of the few flail-type weapons which contributes a gun-firing mechanism. It has the second highest knockback of all weapons, beaten only by the Slap Hand. The Golem Fist has a very short cool down period; therefore its auto-fire rate is dependent only on the distance to its impact, meaning that an enemy or object in close range will cause a faster autofire rate. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.


=== Titanium Trident ===
Description: The Titanium Trident is a Hardmode spear crafted solely using Titanium Bars. It has the highest damage of the "standard" Hardmode Ore spears, but it's still beaten by the Chlorophyte Partisan, which has the highest damage of all Hardmode Ore spears. Unlike the pre-Hardmode Trident, the Titanium Trident does not improve the player's underwater mobility. Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount.

=== Resonance Scepter ===
Description: The Resonance Scepter is a Hardmode, post-Plantera magic weapon which has a 12.5*1/8 (12.5%) chance of dropping from the Princess NPC. When used, it creates glowing pink circles at the cursor's location, which expand and then collapse into sparkles over the course of about 1 second. Rapid damage is dealt to any enemies within the circles throughout the animation, and they are knocked back away from the caster. It is not possible to summon the circles through blocks. The scepter in the player's hand also sparkles while it is used, emitting pink light. Its best modifier is Mythical.

=== Bamboo ===

Like most plants, Bamboo will not grow in front of a wall (including Glass Walls and Fences). Bamboo can also be found in Jungle and Bramble Crates. It can be mined with any pickaxe or drill, and can be used to craft Bamboo-themed furniture, blocks, and walls.

Vitamins are one of the ingredients required to make the Armor Bracing, which is a crafting material required to make the Ankh Charm, an accessory further required to make the Ankh Shield.
